Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Very modern and comfy. Comfortable bed with a great size room. Great lobby area with bar and restaurant. Want to mention that "Lisa B." in the restaurant was an excellent server. She was super friendly, made you feel welcome and made sure we had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QuinnEskimo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean, updated decor, and in a great location. The best part was the staff. They are constantly (not annoyingly so) working to please you and make sure that everything is comfortable and perfect. I will definitely stay here again. Also there are some great restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: PeteVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Liberty Station March 15 through 17th. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and very nice to be in. Although the hotel is close to the airport we did experience any extra loud noise from the airplanes taking off. I would recommend this hotel to a friend or family for a short stay. I cannot comment on the dining as we did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: southtripper
Reviews.Content: Coming to California from the East Coast the first night is always interesting ... due to the time difference. We arrived in San Diego early in the evening CA time. I wanted a hotel easy to get to after collecting bags and the rental car. This hotel was a great choice it is close to the airport.. there are places to eat nearby...even a Starbucks. The staff was great very friendly and welcoming.. the place was spotless, our room was too... there is no charge for parking ...which at other hotels can add $20 a day to the tab.. we returned here for the last night of our stay to have easy access to the airport.. I would do this again without question ..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for air travelers”
Reviews.Author: RuthMc
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here before a 6:15 am flight back to the East Coast. It was wonderful. Room was very nice, quiet and comfortable. The best thing was the on-site restaurant, which meant we did not have to drive anywhere but could have an early dinner and get to bed early. The good was quite good. My husband had mahi-mahi, which was good. It is also near eating/drinking places on the main drag (whose name I have forgotten). We drove up to Cabrillo Point National Monument, which is close and a great place to visit. Would definitely stay here again if we needed a place close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and enjoy San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: MrWhite12
Reviews.Content: First off make sure you get the package that includes breakfast it's really worth it. My kids really enjoyed the waffles and omletes. This is the best breakfast we have had in a hotel. Secondly don't let the proximity to the airport bother you we never heard the planes while in our room. The pool is heated and the bar lets you have some drinks while the kids swim. Overall a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Front desk VERY helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: I was concerned since the sales department dropped the ball on some items prior to my visit. A few days prior Terri (front desk) and Maria (front desk supervisor) were VERY helpful in getting paperwork in order and last minute room requests. Hotel is convenient to airport and rooms have a great view. Very solid Courtyard. I would most likely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: mbyrnetennis
Reviews.Content: had a waterfront king sized room. This hotel is close to the aiport but also close to major attractions and the staff is wonderful. would definitely recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Greenswede
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a Marine graduation and this hotel was very nice. Perfect location. Very clean. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: aaherbst
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business stay. Centrally located. 15 minute drive to the beach. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -- great location!”
Reviews.Author: TalonIP
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our 3-day visit to San Diego. The location close to the airport was great and turned out to be very convenient to restaurants and other necessities on major streets (Nimitz and Rosecrans, to name a couple.) The front staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean and had all the amenities we expected. Our third-floor room was quiet, and the view overlooking the pool was beautiful. The view across the water to the San Diego skyline was also nice. The hotel is adjacent to a Navy property, and a public trail along the canal waterfront in front of the Navy facility provides an excellent place to walk or jog. While the hotel does not provide a free breakfast, the on-site snack bar had a nice selection of breakfast foods, juices, and pastries for sale at reasonable prices, along with nicely-equipped outdoor tables. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Front Desk First Class”
Reviews.Author: KenCz
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Bay Front" room and paid a premium for 4 nights in late January. A bit more than I like to spend but I thought 'waht the heck' it is our vacation. Hotel was very clean, Front Desk Girls were outstanding, Good 'made to order' Breakfast was included in our package. Room was spacious, modern and in good condition. My only complaint was I could NOT see the San Diego Bay from the room even though I paid a premium. All that was visible was 'dead end canal/river' that was a couple of hundred yards away. The acutal Bay was about 1/2 mile way off to the side of the Hotel. My recommendation: Very good hotel but do not book the Premium view Bayfront rooms - just not worth the extra bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a moderately priced stay”
Reviews.Author: KKent
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business very clean, good location. Would not pay for meeting rooms as there are plenty of options on property in semi private settings. Great staff and can byob to pool in red solo cup.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what an unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: bickles27
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised by the high standard of this Courtyard Marriott, the standards have skyrocketed since the last time I stayed in one. The lobby was elegant, the rooms stylish and spacious, the breakfast was wonderful, and best of all, the service was excellent. I had flown in from Australia and my bag didn't make it, so the shuttle driver took me to a shop to get a few toiletries. Later he drove our group to a wine shop, then to a restaurant! The location is perfect it you need to get to the airport. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: bklynguy
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Marriott Liberty station. Great location - quite, pretty neighborhood, park behind the hotel with views of downtown. Nice restaurants in walking distance and an easy drive to all major attractions. Downtown is a 10 min drive away. Three minutes from the airport. Free internet, free coffee throughout the day, free airport shuttle. Opt for the breakfast package - well worth the money. Staff extremely friendly and accommodating. Only issue is for those who are sensitive to noise - if you're not on the top floor, you could be disturbed by the walking above you. They moved us the second night to a top floor upon our request.

Reviews.Title: “Very convienent”
Reviews.Author: CO_Travelers_44
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport, easy to get to the touristy stuff (Seaworld, Zoo, etc), and very accomodating staff. Breakfast was a tad expensive, but free for a 2 year old which helped make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport location”
Reviews.Author: pickyreno
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight, the hotel airport shuttle at 5am was great and saved us having to return a car or getting a taxi. The staff were helpful, the room was clean and ample size, the bed comfortable. The view is of the bay, there is a retaurant on site. It was very nice to find such a comfortable and beautiful spot clse to airport, yet quiet. The soaps and towels could improve, but they are standard courtyard level supplies. Not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for any traveler”
Reviews.Author: UnboundTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard for two nights on a business trip and this hotel has everything you need. The location is just a short drive from the airport and is outside of downtown SD. Parking is FREE. Not something you see in many SD hotels. There are several restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well. Location is great. The front desk staff was very friendly. They even let me check in at 900am because a room was available. The entire property is very clean, there is a full restaurant and bar in the lobby, and the pool area has a nice jacuzzi. Beds are great as well. This would be a great hotel for both families and business travelers to the SD area. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfast, classic Courtyard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoolPro001
Reviews.Content: The breadth and quality of breakfast along with the incredible waitress was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming back home”
Reviews.Author: mikediliberto
Reviews.Content: As long time San Diego residents, we normally spend our time with family and friends. This year, issues at a friend's house precluded us from staying in their guest bedroom, and thus we booked ourselves at the Marriott Liberty Station. We found the location to be ideal to get into downtown, just turn left from the hotel, follow harbor drive and you're there in no time, without even having to get on the freeway. Likewise to get into Ocean Beach, PB, or locations north; simply turn right out of the hotel to get to the beaches or head north on the 8 freeway to La Jolla. In short, we found the location of the Marriott to be ideally centered between the two areas of San Diego where we spend the most time. As they say, the three most important aspects are location, location, location. On top of the fantastic location, the staff at the Marriott could not have been nicer or more accommodating. They upgraded us on check in to a room overlooking the water, and handled our requests with ease. In the room, we found a flatscreen TV, a small fridge, and (most importantly) a Kuerig coffee maker. From the small balcony we could watch the sun set over the Pacific. Remind me again why we moved away from San Diego? Outside of the hotel, the liberty station area has almost every shop and restaurant that you could need, and others, like Target, In-n-out, and rubio's fish tacos, are just a mile or so east on Rosecrans st. Just across from the hotel in the parking lot is Sushi Ya, an amazing sushi restaurant in a town that has never blown me away with it's sushi selection. Also, a Starbucks, and a few other restaurants are within the same parking lot. If you are looking to explore San Diego, there are few locations as good as this one. Stay away from all of the San Diego hotels that line "Hotel Circle" on the 8 freeway and stay here on harbor drive, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, if a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: TrippingtheRoad81
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, over a Saturday. Our room was on the 3rd floor, overlooking the pool/spa area. The room was sparkling clean, decorated nicely and had a very comfortable bed - everything appeared to be updated and quite new. We enjoyed the grounds, surrounding area and the great views from our balcony. Being over the pool/courtyard area was a bit noisy, but not unexpected. The airport noise was louder than we had anticipated, but OK. We felt very safe taking a walk in the area in the evening. On Sunday morning, there were no seats available at the seat-yourself breakfast buffet ($10.50 ea), so we opted to eat elsewhere. A very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ashpsyche
Reviews.Content: My Brother and I stayed here one night while exploring the our old boot camp at RTC/NTC San Diego. I went to their website and found a really good rate using my AAA card. I requested an upper-floor room when making the reservation. When we arrived, there was one family being helped at the front desk, the second we walked up, a friendly and helpful front-desk clerk, Terry was there to check us in. She acknowledged that I had requested the upper-floor room and said she'd do her best to accommodate our request. She got us a room on the top floor with an awesome view! (see photos) She was really helpful with directions and information about the bar, restaurant and breakfast too. The room was very nice, well-maintained and clean, with a huge 32" widescreen HDTV, wireless internet, lots of gizmos so you can view your pictures on the TV, an iHome docking station and a Herman Miller ergo-chair, LOTS of room and a balcony with an incredible view. I'm not sure what brand of beds they are, but that was the most comfortable bed I can remember sleeping in. The sheets were high thread count stuff and each bed had 4 feather pillows. I was out the moment my head hit the very fluffy pillow. The hotel is very nice, but what really made it even nicer was the staff that work there. All the front desk people were really friendly and would smile and greet us as we were coming in and going out. I'm a grumpy old man when it comes to customer service and I was really impressed with the staff at Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Airport/Liberty Station and how friendly they all were and how they all seemed to enjoy working there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floyd4
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 10 night stay. Our room was well maintained, reasonably quiet and loads of room plus a view of the pool. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, down to free soap/softener for the laundry - bonus with 2 kids! My husband used the gym which had a fantastic variey of equipment plus surrounding area great for running/sports etc. Supermarket and various stores just a few minutes walk away.Also quite a few restaurants to choose from, recommend Oggies Sports bar for the food and ambience. We loved the military history of the building itself and surrounding area. I thoroughly check the reviews on here and pleased to stay this hotel met all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smrlb66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at that hotel before flying home from a 5-week holiday in California. The hotel is very nice with clean, spacious rooms. Wi-Fi available free for first 24-hour and free parking for our rental car. It's close proximity to the San Diego airport. The check-in/out was fast and easy. Walking distance to several restaurants. We would stay there again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and super friendly staff! You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: C C
Reviews.Content: I am very picky with my hotel, and I was pleasantly surprised when I walked into the hotel room during my stay in December, 2011. The room was very clean and spacious, and the decor is very modern. Furniture are still fairly new. Even though we did not get a room facing the water, that didn't affect our stay at all. On top of all I just mentioned, every single one of the staff members I met there was very friendly and helpful. Overall speaking, I am very happy with my stay here. We stayed at the Marriott in Anaheim after San Diego, and this Courtyard hotel is way better than the Marriott hotel in A. I will definitely stay here again when I am in the SD area. :) My kids love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION, FREE PARKING, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: aerobicpt
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at this hotel. We stayed the week after Christmas which was much more crowded than the previous time we had stayed. I cancelled other hotel reservations for that week so that we could stay here since our first experience was so good! To get to the point, the location is excellent, close to downtown and the airport. Parking is free. Every staff member happy, accomodating, and willing to take an extra step for customers. They offer laundry detergent free! Value is great. We have had a suite both times and pleased with the value. If you have your choice, request 4th floor suite. Breakfast buffet has amazing staff and is a wonderful value. Can go for a walk along the water. Can walk to several restaurants and Starbucks. The hotel is extremely close to downtown, which is easy to access, and literally 7-10 minutes away from the airport. The hotel does provide a shuttle to the airport, and one of the drivers, Sandy, was amazing. My husband and I did not use the shuttle, we got to know Sandy because she was one of the first to greet us upon our arrival. Throughout the week, we saw a lot of Sandy. She would help in the restaurant when it was busy, she was helping people at the front, she would be helping out other staff members in different areas. All the while, no matter where she was, she had a smile on her face. But we noticed this alot in this hotel. The GM, Rick Brown, was actually clearing tables for the breakfast buffet several days we were there. Nice to see a GM hands on with the staff! One of the waitresses at the buffet, we noticed at another area in the hotel helping out, and she also drives the shuttle. Her name is Lisa B and she was incredibly happy and personable. The breakfast buffet was very busy the week we stayed, and Lisa had a smile on her face, greeting customers by name, all week. Larry and Anna also worked the breakfast buffet, dinner, and the bar and always happy. Larry, fabulous personality, took time with every customer despite the level of activity! If the staff is that happy and so willing to work in other areas, the hotel must be doing something right. It is a pleasure to stay somewhere where the employees are genuinely grateful to be there and want to be there. .

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Hombresg33
Reviews.Content: I came down to SD on a fishing trip, the hotel is close to several landings. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The place was very quiet rooms, I loved the Keurig .Very nice view of the bay and surrounding area. Its was very hard to find the hotel so look for the repurposed Naval ship in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: GTPTCO
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to warm and friendly. The whole area to new (used to be part of a navy base) and really well set out. The room we had was a balcony, overlooking the pool and from the balcony we could see the city skyline. The bed was fine for me as were the room facilities. The hotel has a small market for you small bits and pieces. There are no shops close by. There is also a small cafe that is staffed by friendly people. We did not use the dining room, but decided to stay at the bar for light meal. The bar was run by a fellow (cannot remember his name) who made us feel welcome. This is a great place to stay as it is quiet (although the airport is nearby). I did not notice the planes, our visit was in winter so we had the doors closed most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful surrounding won our hearts”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilySingapore
Reviews.Content: Totally won over by the peaceful surrounding upon arrival in evening & even more so in the morning looking across at the city of San Diego. We asked for a city view upon arrival & the staff was so accommodating & gave us the best room available. Really appreciate that. It has a view overlooking the San Diego Bay & City. The room is spacious & pretty, just as what you see in the photos. The buffet breakfast is value for money & is strongly recommended! The hotel is very clean & in our 4 nights 5 days there have had no unpleasant encounters at all. We love the morning walks along the walking trails. Even though we could hear the sounds of the aeroplanes, it didn't bother us at all. We had really yummy thai food just outside but unfortunately was told by the owner that they were moving to Point Loma in 2012.The japanese joint was always crowded with waiting lines so we never did try. Sugg going before 6pm if you are dining in the evenings. The area is very safe & in fact San Diego is a really nice place. We drove the distance to Calsbag Factory Outlets, we drove to the La Jolla Coast by the Pacific Ocean, which offers the most spectacular views of southern California view!!! We hope to be back one day & spend more time at San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Uncrowded hotel so close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Marriott Courtyard Liberty Station. After trial and error, we found that we could reach the Courtyard by going through the shopping complex on Laning Road at N Harbor Drive. We had room 221 with a porch about as wide as a chair, overlooking the park and and the inlet that leads to San Diego Bay. Pluses Lots of free parking-- a rarity in San Diego. Free soft drink and coffee in the lobby. We loved the pink watermelon juice. Small but adequate room with more than enough electric plugs (I counted six outlets on the desk alone). Fully-equipped room with refrigerator, coffee maker, sofa, table, desk Free wi-fi for any number of devices, strong signal Von's and a big Trader Joe's are not far away; the whole of Liberty Station is central and uncrowded. Very friendly and helpful reception staff Very easy access to downtown and the airport Reasonably quiet room Great mattress and pillows Minus The housekeeping supervisor charged into our room twice without knocking. Sure glad we were decent both times Check-in is 4 pm. We can remember when it was 2 pm Elevator slow to come even though it served only 4 floors We don't consider the minuses very important, and we had a very comfortable stay. We booked on the Marriott website, and we felt the price was a very good deal. We recommend this Marriott Courtyard for a comfortable stay in virtually the center of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: alohamommy1
Reviews.Content: Room and facilities were clean and comfortable. 5 minutes froom san diego airport. very convenient location. rooms were modern and fresh. front desk staff were average. check in took longer than expected as the man in the front kept ignoring me to answer phone calls. lobby seemed noisy in the evening, drunk yelling obnoxious people. Front desk did nothing to get these people to leave/ quiet down. free parking, and internet. you can hear the planes, but nothing really disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Jason B
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched and read and read review after review after review here on tripadvisor trying to find a great hotel for my recent stay for the Marine Graduation this past weekend, and after searching high and searching low, i settled on this Marriott because of the countless great reviews and location. It's close to the airport but not too close, and it's close to the MCRD (Marine Base), and it's close to Rosecrans which is a popular street with tons of food options etc. This hotel lives up to it's high ranking #5 out of 247 hotels in the San Diego area. The rooms are excellent, spacious, well appointed with a flat screen tv, mini refrigerator, A/V hookups to watch videos if you have your camcorder or laptop with you and want to watch footage on the TV, cable including HBO, very spacious bathroom, granite counters, and even granite window sills. The staff is SUPER friendly, the lobby and main areas are immaculate, the fitness center has 24 hour access, unlike many hotels that limit access, the jacuzzi was awesome as was the pool, the location has the harbor to the rear, a huge open park and trails, plus a beach area, and it's in a very upscale looking neighborhood. The business center is free to use, ie free internet access and a printer, plus free wi-fi in the rooms. There's a market attached to it that has starbucks plus other sandwich type deli items, plus a little store for knick knacks if you've forgotten something or need a little something extra (protein drinks, candy bars, chips, batteries, etc). Parking is FREE!! Which is impossible to find at a hotel in this class. So i basically had no complaints whatsoever and really can't imagine how anyone could complain on this hotel. Sure you hear planes, you're near an airport. They stop flying around 10p and they start around 630am, but again it's not anything major. The planes aren't directly over head so it isn't super loud. I've decided that each time i return back to san diego, unless i'm renting some beach condo with a ton of friends, i will definitely be staying at this hotel again and again and would recommend it to any and everyone. Excellent. :) I stayed two nights (dec 7 - 9, 2011).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samantha_Marie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, and was extremely happy. I took a day off from work to accompany my husband on a 3-day business trip. If you have a car or rental, this hotel is a great value. It's on the opposite side of the airport from the convention center and mega-hotels costing 2 - 3x as much, right off Harbor Blvd. It takes about 10 minutes to get to the downtown / convention center - a nice waterfront drive. The Courtyard is located behind a shopping area with some restaurants, so you can't see it from the street, but it isn't hard to find. Now and again you might hear a plane, but it wasn't an ongoing issue. The outside is plain-ish, but nice - typical Courtyeard. The rooms are well appointed and new. There is a TV and hook-ups for electronics, and there is free wifi, as well as a business center where you can use a computer (if you didn't bring one) and color printer for free. There is a Keurig coffee maker and a fridge, as well as an iron, ironing board, and hair dryer. A microwave might have been nice. The bed was comfortable. Towels were big, but skimpy. Everyone on staff was nice, and the front desk helped me configure my laptop, which wasn't recognizing the wifi. Turns out it was the computer, and they showed me what to do. One downside was the breakfast was $12.50, and for a party of 2. It was not worth it to pay more for the room in order to get a "free" breakfast. Another issue was that there wasn't an ice machine on every floor. After a long day, it was not fun to get back to the room and have to go down the hall and up a flight of stairs to get ice. I paid just over $100/per night for a king size bed and sleeper-sofa, which would be great for small kids. A room with two queen beds would work for a family with older kids. When I dropped off my husband at the convention center, I did think it would have been nice to have stayed at the Hilton or Marriott virtually next door. But this way, we could afford for me to come along, and I had a rental car to do some sightseeing and shopping. And, really, what's more important here?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KUFan_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip because I didn't like the look of the hotel that the work conference was at. I was SO glad that I stayed here instead. The price was very reasonable, and the rate that I chose included breakfast (hot and cold buffet along with a waffle and omelet chef). Very tasty and quick if you are looking to have a good meal before getting on the road. The room was very comfortable, very clean, and met all of my needs. The hotel staff was pleasant as well. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for layover or night before travel”
Reviews.Author: Kid_Dynamite
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location twice. It is very close & quick to the airport. The Beds are VERY comfy. Rooms are very nice. There is a small bar downstairs for drinks. Staff was very nice & helpful. They have a free shuttle to take you to the airport. There is also a nice Pizza joint just about a block down that is great for eating. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for Thanksgiving weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: kennethdmarks
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here with my parents while visiting my sister in San Diego over Thanksgiving. Was always clean, pool and hottub were never too crowded, in a great area for running and taking in the harbor scenery. Also very convenient to the airport, harbor drive, and the major roads leading to downtown and all over San Diego. Can't really get better than that.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cnpila
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, spacious, nicely decorated. I got lost the first time around because I thought I entered a restaurant mall and immediately exited. After driving around the airport and getting back to the same place, I saw the Marriott sign and ventured deeper into the property. There was a homewood suite, hilton garden inn and Marriott courtyard to the back of the property by the water. Parking can be tight during the weekend but I still found one close enough to the hotel. Lots of good restaurants just outside the hotel. Nice area to bike and jog. Will definitely consider staying here next time I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in revitalized Liberty Station area”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here because it was close to downtown and we would have access to all of San Diego. I would have chosen to stay downtown, and could have for the same price ($150) at the Marriott marina or the Omni, but I hate parking fees and both charge in the $35 - $40 range so I went with Liberty Station. I was glad we did. Nice rooms overlooking the bay inlet, plenty of free parking, and a great bar with good wine and beer selections. The shuttle driver took us to dinner at Solare, a nearby Italian restaurant (read reviews - good place). There is also an Oggi's pizza across the street. It rained the whole day we were there so we did not explore the walking trail, or pool, but could see both from our room and they looked very nice. I really liked our shuttle driver, who gave us a little tour of Liberty Station and the buildings. Lindbergh Field was landing planes from the ocean in the evening so they were flying right over the area very low. It was fun for me and they stop by 10:00 ish so not a bad distraction, but more of an attraction. Hotel has easy access to the coast, Old Town, downtown, the airport, Point Loma, restaurants, etc. overall, a good choice of accommodations if you don't need to be right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BaySFtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King room for one night. Rooms were clean and decor was tasteful. What was really nice was that the king bed was actually parallel to the door (against the other side of the bathroom wall) facing the window. There wasn't much of a view on the bottom floor, but it was nice to wake up with your feet facing the sunlit window. We didn't hear the planes but we did hear excess noise from outside the door, mainly when people passed by. It didn't bother us but it some others might not be as tolerant to the noise. The computer business center was convenient to use and print out boarding passes. The location is great with the airport and Shelter Island within a 5 minute drive, and Cabrillo Monument, Ocean Beach and Mission Bay (Sea World) about 10-20 minutes away. I would suggest exploring the Liberty Station for your convenient needs like grocery stores, restaurants and shops. Finally I'm not sure if I could mention names so I'll keep it general... If you're looking for a great Sunday Morning brunch, there is a hawaiian style restaurant on Shelter Island that offers a great champagne brunch. Enjoy San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and location but you can hear the planes”
Reviews.Author: 4vrongo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for a long weekend, as promised by tp reviewers the place was well kept and more than the usual courtyard. We paid for the water view room 231 however much as others wrote at least from that room you can definitely hear the planes take off etc. It was not a problem for us as it does stop by midnight and doesn't resume until 6am, we were on east coast time so we adjusted well. However if you are a light sleeper the parking lot side might be a better choice. The room although small was a nice set up with a mini sofa and tables. The keurig maker was a really nice touch. We did do the breakfast buffet two mornings and it was excellent. We also ended up having a light supper the last night there and it was very delicious. I was impressed as most chain hotels have mediocre food. The front desk though is very helpful with restaurant recommendations and they were excellent ones. The outdoor faciiities are nice and we had a very large patio with our room. It is very easy to get to places from the Courtyard and we had thought of staying at the Coronado and we were glad we stayed at the courtyard instead. If it was summer and we were there longer I might have a different view. I would have given the courtyard a 5 star except for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: momlin
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby very nice clean rooms but terrible beds,hard as a rock.Didnt sleep a wink

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: mypctechs
Reviews.Content: What more to say? The view is excellent and the location is perfectly placed near sunset cliffs, the zoo, sea world, mission beach and just about everything else you'll want to see. The room was well designed, the grounds were well kept, and I was very pleased with the entire experience. You can't beat the price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, elites take notice”
Reviews.Author: G0lf18
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, close to the Navy base and airport. Hotel did not recognize my platinum status and ignored my profile. Frequent travelers might like the property next door (Homewood Suites), though same owners, better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: AZToolman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a nice three night stay at the Liberty Station Courtyard. It is located on the grounds of the old naval training base, right off of Harbor Blvd and near the airport. Because of the way that the main runway is aligned, we never had any problems with noise from take-off and landings at the airport, just a little from the room next door, but no more that you would expect from most hotels. The location made it very easy to access all parts of San Diego, Harbor and Shelter Islands, downtown, Balboa Park and the zoo and Mission Bay. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Due to it's location there seemed to be many reunions of older naval commands taking place and also a wedding but none of the events made for a rowdy or unpleasant situation. I would recommend this hotel and location for any trip to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Annr95
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with this hotel. I believe I have high standards for hotels and this one met every one of them. The staff was phenomenal. Stephanie checked us in and helped us several times after that check in as well and she was fantastic, friendly, informative and helpful. She seemed to actually like her job. Every other staff member that we came into contact with was also great, Stephanie just stood out. The hotel was very clean. We always check for bed bugs at every hotel, no matter how nice the hotel and we did not find any. The bathroom was very clean, even the grout was nice and white with no mold. Housekeeping was great! There was ample parking and it is included in the price. The only thing that may have been nice would be for them to take license plate numbers for the hotel guests because we found a car with the lights on and there wasn't a way for the desk to find out whose car that was. We didn't think we would utilize the on site laundry, but after a day falling in the water at the tide pools, we needed to. The facilities were very clean and the soap and fabric softener is complimentary. We did not use the gym or the pool but we did look at them and I was very impressed with the quality of the gym equipment. It looked to be some really high quality gym equipment, there were ample numbers of treadmills. The pool and pool area looked very nice and I appreciated the no smoking signs because this area can become a smoking haven if allowed. There is a small restaurant on site, we did not use it. They do not have complimentary breakfast, but there is a starbucks within walking distance and it's probably the best starbucks that I have ever been to. They do usually have complimentary coffee/tea available. A very slight draw back is the TV, because of the set up, we couldn't channel surf, we needed to choose each channel by picking the number. It's just a slight inconvenience, no big deal really. I was a little concerned about the location of the hotel, it seemed from internet resources to be so close to the airport and not so close to the city, but in reality, it's nice that it's close to the airport and the planes are not annoying. The airport has a curfew because it is actually inside the city, so there are no take offs and landings at night. I would not consider this hotel outside the city at all, it was right where I would choose to be again. It is pretty close to the USS Midway, and some great restaurants. The city is pretty compact, so it was easy to drive to anything in the city from the hotel and there was easy access to the highways, too. Tip: Ask the front desk for their list of restaurant recommendations, they are all great. I would specifically recommend The Fish Market and Phil's BBQ. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Liberty as promised”
Reviews.Author: WandaJoyGlobeAZ
Reviews.Content: Very Pleased, located in redeveloped area of Naval Training Base "Liberty Station". Rooms were Cheery, Clean & Quiet, Bed and Bedding were very comfy. Walking Trails and Park just outside the Hotel. Dining Choices a Few Blocks North; great home base to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLaMirada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the hotel and found our stay to be very nice. The hotel has spacious rooms, which were very quiet considering that there was an airport nearby. Our room had a view and a balcony. All the decor was very modern and the rooms were extremely clean. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast which was about $10. We were neaby Anthony's restaurant and the Fish Market, so we dined there in the evenings. There is a large park nearby so we walked the park near the shore line and enjoyed being out in the fresh air. The front desk service was helpful and answered all our questions regarding our stay. We would definitely consider this hotel for any future stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Hotel, But Loud”
Reviews.Author: pearl333333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very nice setting, right on the water next to a well-used path. The rooms are well-designed; they are beautiful to look out and easy to "live in." Also, everything was clean, in the room and around the hotel. The pool was clean, the perfect temperature and an OK size. Most things are really perfect about this hotel, except the noisy hallways. On both Friday and Saturday night, we were kept up by people being quite loud in the hall. Also, on Sunday morning, we were roused by a fire alarm at about 5:00. It appeared that an employee in the cafe burned something, causing all the hotel guests to be evacuated. I wonder what they can do about the noise. I want them to do something because I would love to return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lilach_Eisenberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is super close to the airport - VERY quiet! you can't hear the airplans. It's close to the main attractions like Sea world, Zoo etc. The service was great, everyone was very helpfull. Class A rooms with comfey bed. We would recommend to ask for a room on a high floor (higer then the first floor). We LOVED it and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: At first I was a bet skeptical of a Courtyard taking the #4 spot of all hotels in San Diego, but let me say, after spending 2 nights here I could not agree more with the ranking. This Courtyard definitely has more of a full-service Marriott feel than a typical Courtyard. From the friendly staff, full-service restaurant and resort-like pool and spa (complete with palm trees a fire pit), these are amenities that I do not normally expect at a Courtyard. The location is another plus. The Liberty Station area has a lot going for it and is not far from downtown San Diego and the Gaslamp district, but unless you really need that kind of night life, there's enough to do as far as dining right in the Liberty Station/Point Loma area. The desk clerk was helpful with recommendations. My only real complaint is the run of the mill room I received as a Gold Elite member. I have come to realize that Couryard's are much more hit-or-miss in offering what should be a guaranteed upgrade (space permitting of course, but this was the middle of the week and space was permitting) than are full service Marriott's. This doesn't really make sense to me, but it is what it is. I didn't complain and ask to be moved because the room itself was nice, but I was hoping to automatically receive a room overlooking the pool and the water. I'll definitely stay here again when business brings me back to the area, but will make a specific room request prior to arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick business trip”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: I had to pick up a coworker at the airport early in the morning, so I stayed overnight at the Courtyard one night. Got in late and left early, but everything was great. East to get to/find, nice room, good bathroom. The cafe was great for a light breakfast. Check-in and check-out were efficient. Internet was free and fast. Parking was free. Five minutes to the airport. Starbucks is nearby. Pillows were mediocre, but otherwise no complaints. Would definitely stay here again when back in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Theglorias3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, the service is the best. Super great value if you get the breakfast included in your room rate. The staff at breakfast is great!! Our room had a great view of the water and the pool. They have a great "quite" time starting at 10pm!! And the parking is free!! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, more on par with a nice Marriott or say Westin rather than the more budget oriented Courtyard line. It's a low rise building going up four floors. Everything is new and modern, from the lobby to the guest rooms. My room overlooked the pool area and had a balcony with a couple of chairs, nice for sitting out and enjoying the beautiful San Diego weather. The full buffet breakfast was around $12 and had a good selection of hot and cold foods including an omelet station. Free parking, free wifi. 5 minutes from the airport and 15 minutes to downtown, don't even have to get on the freeway. The only drawback to the location is that you can see and hear jets taking off in the distance even with the window closed. It stops at night but picked up early the next morning. Still, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable choice close to airport”
Reviews.Author: BallardDancer
Reviews.Content: Our king room was on the small side, but we were here only 1 night so it didn't matter a lot. The bed was comfy, and the noise from the airport was minimal and not an issue for us at all. Many of the guests are military personnel or business people with business with the Navy. Breakfast was good with an omelet bar and plenty of choices for all tastes. It was slow only because we arrived for breakfast just as the working people's rush was ending. The location was very convenient for us and easy to find. There's a park (and playground) and walking path behind the hotel for those who need to stretch their legs, or with small kids who need a run.

Reviews.Title: “A good San Diego Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: dizzle0772
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a close friend's Navy wedding. Wedding was at the Naval Base across the street, rooms were nice, not cleaned very well in between our stay though. Our second night the fire alarm went off at 6 in the morning, because of "smoke in the kitchen". Overall had a good time, surrounding area is nice, places to go, things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near Airport”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative about this hotel. Very close to the airport, but were not bothered by any airport noise. Only 4-5 blocks from a shopping center that has Starbucks, Panera Bread, Trader Joes & numerous restaurants. Other restaurants/coffee shops etc., only 1-2 blocks walking distance. Typical Courtyard, which means no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “great great great”
Reviews.Author: honey464
Reviews.Content: this was a wonderful clean and quiet hotel-the desk staff and wait staff were excellent in every way. the girls at the front desk were very helpful providing directions and eating places. i found this thru trip advisor and all the reviews were so on-- thanks for making our trip exceptional and fun .ps- you can't hear the planes--amazing

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: Emily T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from September 8-12, 2011. It's the perfect location, particularly if you have young children. There's a nice, big playground in the Liberty Station area that only takes 5 minutes to walk to on a nice paved running/biking path from the hotel. Some of the playground is on soft turf and some is on sand, so take your sand toys. The front desk told us they had sand toys we could borrow, but we never did. Next to the playground is a bathroom as well, which is convenient with young kids. The playground was extremely clean and had a nice number of kids playing on it. The playground overlooks a river or inlet of some kind, so nice for the parents to enjoy as well. The beautiful jogging trail goes for miles! If you want to walk a little further, you can walk 10 minutes from the hotel on a paved path and go over the foot bridge to the bay where there's a beach (Spanish Landing) and the kids can safely play in the water. There's also a playground and a bathroom facility at this area as well. Trader Joe's is a 10 minute walk from the hotel, which was convenient for us to get some groceries for the mini-fridge in the hotel room. There are many other stores in the same complex as Trader Joe's, but we never checked them out. Liberty Station (where the hotel is) has several restaurants and we highly recommend Oggi's. When the power was out in all of southern California for 12 hours or so, they were trying to accomodate customers by working in their kitchen by flashlight. Very hard workers and good food! The front desk staff was wonderful and helpful. They remembered us by name and greeted us each time we came and went. We did rent a car and loved the free parking at the hotel. The hotel itself and the individual rooms are clean and modern. The WiFi worked smoothly for us as well. Their breakfast buffet was reasonable and we thought it had a nice variety (oatmeal, pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, bagels, english muffins, juices, coffee, etc) for the price of $10. Was $12 if you wanted the hot food (eggs, waffles, sausage, bacon). The pool was the perfect temperature and never over crowded when we were there. Although, it is starting to get a little cooler in San Diego at this time of year, especially when the sun goes down, so take layers! We could hear airplanes from time to time and could see them out our window, but it didn't bother our 3 year old during naps and didn't keep us awake at night. I think the volume of planes flying significantly drops from 11 PM- 7 AM , which helped. If you are a super sensitive sleeper, take ear plugs, but we didn't think it was an issue. The location of this hotel is great with it being next to the airport and only a 5 minute drive to downtown. All the conveniences you need are right around the hotel. If we return to San Diego, we'll stay at this hotel for sure and will recommend it to everyone we know. If you have children, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: richvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Courtyard for 2 nights while going to San Diego Zoo. 10 minute drive to zoo. Very nice and Clean room, well maintained property with water and walking trail out back-which our balcony overlooked. One of the best courtyards we have stayed and will definitely be back! Restuarant food was very good as we were pleasently surprised-most hotel restaurants -well-just aren't that good-but Shades is well worth it. Only small drawback was you can't check out on the TV like most hotels-but only had to wait a few minutes at front desk to do so. Not sure why this modern hotel doesn't have this feature? Stay here-you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Trip!”
Reviews.Author: shaq4545
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Labor Day weekend at this hotel with our 2 girls (ages 2 and 3). At first we were looking into staying Downtown as there was an Art Fair we wanted to attend but after much consideration, we found this hotel and read the reviews and thought we'd give it a shot. It looked more kid-friendly than the hotels in Downtown San Diego. It really exceeded our expectations! Great water front location, great staff, clean rooms, nice decor, nice outdoor pool & patio area, and excellent food options in the area. There is a nice walkway and about a mile from the hotel, there is a nice park with two playgrounds (one for older kids and the other for toddlers). Also, in the Liberty Station area there is a restaurant called the Corvette Diner that we stumbled upon which is a 50's Diner where the staff dresses up and the women have beehive hairstyles and dance around. The girls loved it and so did we. The location of the hotel is convenient and close to Downtown and Coronado (which we loved). Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: basketkase999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the Labor Day weekend at the Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Airport/Liberty Station to celebrate her birthday and we were not disappointed. We booked the 2 room suite with a king bed. According the the front desk, there are only 3 of these types of rooms in the hotel. The hotel is very close to San Diego International Airport. The hotel provides a shuttle between the airport and hotel. While a bit disconnected from the rest of San Diego, the hotel is still conveniently located. Most major attractions are within a 20-25 minute drive. Our initial impression of the property came during the check in process. The lobby has a sit down restaurant, bar, and "shop" with snacks and sundries. Just off of the lobby, there is also a deli. The staff in the lobby were helpful during check in and checkout, however, when we were trying to check in at our guaranteed 4pm time, they indicated to us that their engineering team wanted to paint a portion of our ceiling and the room would not be available for another 2+ hours. After discussing it with them, I was able to convince them to move this maintenance item until after we checked out. We we got to the room, we couldn't even find the spot where they wanted to paint. The room was in excellent shape with a fold out sofa, chair, and desk in the "living" room. The bedroom was also quite spacious and open with a king size bed and 37in (I believe) television. Both the living room and bedroom had a mini fridge. We were unfortunately booked into a handicapped accessible room, which meant a open shower. This caused most of the floor to get soaking wet as the water drained out of the center of the bathroom. Not something we are used to, but clearly understandable need. The bed was comfortable but a bit firm for our taste. The soft pillows did make up for that, however. The bedroom had great blackout curtains, which allowed us to sleep in without having the sunshine wake us up too early. The down side to have the large suite was the lack of view. It was placed in an area of the hotel that blocked any kind of view. This wasn't important to us as we were out of the hotel room most of our trip, but good to note. One of the biggest selling points of this hotel was parking. Most of the downtown hotels have limited or no self parking. Those which did charge anywhere in the range of $25-$35. We were willing to drive a few extra minutes to our destinations to get the free and ample parking. The Courtyard by Marriott at San Diego Airport/Liberty Station lived up the to the high standards that I have come to expect from from Marriott properties. I wouldn't hesitate in booking a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - can't wait to go back - Resort feel at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: bk_ny_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in late August / early September on our last leg of our family's SoCal vacation. There are no words that I can express on how pleased we were with our stay at this property. The staff is absolutely amazing. We want to acknowledge and thank Miriam & Thomas (front desk), Hector (server), Jim (bartender), and Christian (cafe manager) for making our vacation memorable. We've decided to join the Marriott Rewards club after staying here. Here's a quick Pro/Con rundown: Pro: - Amazingly well maintained hotel - the entire property including the rooms were immaculately maintained and cleaned - the housekeeping staff should be commended and rewarded for such an excellent job. - Great location - Mins to all attractions & Airport. Also walking distance to other conveniences (pharmacy, supermarket, etc.). - Outdoor Space - pool, jacuzzi, firepit, patios, lounge areas - we spent hours relaxing here. Created the resort feel. - Great breakfast buffet (this is an addl price, but worth it in my opinion). For Dinner, we ate at the hotel 3 times during our 5 night stay. The clam chowder, thai chicken wings, and hawaiian ribeye were faves. - Guest Laundry - large room with 4 sets of washes & dryers - never had to wait for a free machine. -Free Parking & WiFi!! Cons: - More hooks / bars to store towels in bathrooms - esp for a family of four staying in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from a Courtyard...& more”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui F
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening to a very warm & friendly welcome (starting with the shuttlebus from the airport). The room was slightly larger than a normal 2 queen bed room and the Bay view (available at extra cost) well worth it. A larger balcony area would have been better but all are constrained. Hotel has a quiet period overnight which is very welcome though a little intimidating with young children! Great location for getting to city tourist sites & surprisingly little disturbance from the airport. Restaurant & cafe didn't inspire but in a good location for other out of hotel options. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: HImommy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning and end of our CA trip because of the Courtyard's proximity to the airport. So happy we chose the Courtyard. The front desk staff was so friendly and helpful. Although it seemed like a business hotel, our family felt comfortable. Room felt clean and new. Wish the lighting had been a bit better. Lots of plugs and outlets on the desk. Bathroom had lots of towels and counterspace :), but not many towel bars or hooks. For a family of four, paying a little more for the Stay for Breakfast pkg was totally worth it -- the yummy buffet included cooked-to-order omelets and waffles, eggs, meat, potatoes, veggies, fresh fruits, breads, bagels and lox, yogurt, oatmeal, and cold cereals. Location was close to Sea World and the San Diego Zoo. Also close to Trader Joe's, Target, and other stores and restaurants. Loved the free parking and the Sushiya restaurant across the way. Only minor disappointments -- an elevator was out-of-order during our return stay and on our last night, I awoke around 1 am because of a party in the next room. After debating for about 20 minutes whether to complain to the front desk, I thought I heard a knock on the next door and things seemed to quiet down. Aside from that, we really liked this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the bucks”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, convenient to everything, nice walking path along waterway, and the room was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: wspears
Reviews.Content: Thank you fellow TripAdvisor members. I booked this hotel based on the reviews and was not disappointed. The staff were very helpful when we arrived and offered several options of rooms to see what would suit our family best. We settled on a courtyard, poolside room with two queen beds for myself and my husband and our two boys. It was lovely to have a small patio where we could sit in the late evening after the boys went to bed. The room was beautiful - it's like they addressed all complaints that travellers usually have: there were plenty of pillows, the beds were comfortable, there was a little espresso nook, PLENTY of counter space in the bathroom and lots of towels. We stayed at the end of our two week vacation in California and it was by far the nicest place we stayed. The only thing that was kind of annoying was the smoke detector. I assume there is some kind of regulation that stipulates that it must have a light on it, but I wonder why the hotel chose one that has a bright "camera flash" every 30 seconds and then mounted it right over the bed? Not very pleasant. Other than that, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and brilliant staff.”
Reviews.Author: LondonStagman
Reviews.Content: This was our final hotel of a three week trip and it was excellent. When we first arrived, it seem a long way from how we had read the reviews but in San Diego, everywhere is a bit further away than it seems and this is very central for everything. Front desk were very helpful and we liked the extra towels and choice of pillows. Jim, who runs the bar was a real star and worth having a chat to him for suggestions of places to go. Lived up to its excellent reviews and thanks for a lovely few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AnneChristineE
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week stay at the Courtyard Marriot San Diego LIberty Station. This was an altogether pleasant experience from beginning to end. The staff, from the front desk to the restaurant, deli and housekeeping were excellent. They were consistently friendly, polite and very helpful in regards to remedying a tiny concern we had. (missing sofa chair in our room). The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. In terms of location the hotel is near the airport, however, if you know San Diego this is not far from the city at all and also very close to Old Town. We had a car so the ample free parking at the hotel was a bonus. As parking in the city can be tricky we did cab it one night at a price of 16 dollars each direction. Parking at Old Town in the various San Diego State Park parking lots (free) or on the street never gave us a problem. I personally would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again and expect I very likely will in the not too distant future. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Will return when able..”
Reviews.Author: sadbuttrue
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this place is sold out a lot but I can see why. I was able to book a stay here after escaping the disastrous Residence Inn Mission Valley and very happy I did. Granted, you get a small fridge and you have to request a microwave but with it being walking (crawling) distance to pubs and other eateries, I enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, and Very convenient for an early AM flight”
Reviews.Author: jackstrawfromwichita
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and used airport shuttle to catch 7am flight. Seems very new, with rooms very nice and clean exceeding typical Courtyard standards. Bar was nice, with a few good San Diego area beers on tap. Service was very good. I ditched my rental car in the afternoon and the hotel shuttle was willing to come pick me up. Since I was alone on foot the rest of the day they also offered to drive me out to a nearby restaurant. The location has a few places to walk to nearby, but it's a bit isolated due to the Navy bases nearby and their very tall fences. So, there's nothing wrong with the hotel, but based on location I have to say that I'd only stay here to make an early flight departure more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Clean quiet safe stay over”
Reviews.Author: jwire25
Reviews.Content: Safe area, clean rooms, helpful staff, free parking, and good location for getting around sd

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the reviews you read!”
Reviews.Author: cnakatani
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel solely based upon trip advisor reviews and I'm sorry I did. I don't know what type of hotel the other reviewers are used to staying, but unless your thing is small rooms, hard beds, rough sheets, thin towels and loud a/c's then this hotel is not for you. Also we went out all day to come back to uncleaned room. The only good thing about this hotel is location, but Homewood Suites is next door and looks nicer and with bigger rooms I would recommend that hotel for the area instead.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: LUVSYVCA
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter, and I stayed here while in the area looking at colleges. The hotel is very nice, lovely grounds and pool area, and Kurt and Stephanie at the front desk were VERY helpful and accommodating. We asked for an upgrade, and were very happily awarded one. YAY! The beds were very comfy, the rooms spacious, and the bathrooms up to date and spotless. We also never heard any exterior noises.....a very peaceful hotel indeed! The cooked to order breakfast buffet in the morning was very good, and a great send off from our brief stay. If in the area again, we will definitely return to this Courtyard Marriott, especially since the location is close and convenient to a lot of the local San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- great location”
Reviews.Author: DrVille
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Courtyard hotel -- just a few years old and very clean. Pros **Nice lobby, rooms, and heated pool **Ample free parking **Great walking path along the water with playgrounds for kids **Location - away from the really busy areas, but still just a short drive to downtown, parks, and Coronado **Walking distance to restaurants (Mex, Panera, Tender Greens, etc) and shopping (Trader Joe's) **Nice fitness center near pool with easy access Cons (not really any, but...) **The hot breakfast is great but not included in most rates **If you want to make this a walking trip, a downtown location like the Omni, Hilton, Hyatt would be closer to Petco Field (players stay at the Omni), USS Midway, and the restaurants of the Gaslamp district. Overall though you can't go wrong with this Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: BeachLove1010
Reviews.Content: Perfect, quiet spot for our "Daycation". Less than 5 minutes away from one of the best dinners we've ever had (Island Prime). Loved the free coffee, and they made connecting to the Internet super easy (both wifi and wired). Everything was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful with local recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Got My Card Ran Twice by Front Desk, Couldn't Spend Money”
Reviews.Author: Janet K
Reviews.Content: I went to Courtyard Marriott and no problems going in and going up to my room. I finally get there, go out to eat and realize that my card has been declined. I booked the trip on travelocity and so everything was already paid for, but apparently Courtyard decided to run the card again by "accident" for $1200. Since I had about $1000 in the back, basically my card was declined and I had no money to spend. When I told the front desk, they said they would release it after the weekend when the banks opened back up. So because the hotel made this mistake, I was stuck not able to spend any money and not eat for the weekend, and I got no gesture from the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “"Give me Liberty and I'll be happy"”
Reviews.Author: Eileencooks
Reviews.Content: In San Diego for a conference held at the Sheraton which was only 2 miles away. Chose a Marriott property to use my points. Many Marriott properties within 10 miles but this looked the best due to free internet wireless in rooms and free parking plus proximity to conference. Staff on phone and at desk friendly and helpful. Listened to another Trip Advisor member's comments and chose not to overlook the pool which seemed very noisy. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the parking lot below but never heard any noise on the 4th floor. Looked over some hills and houses but couldn't see any cars when sitting on the couch or the balcony. Loved that thermos pots of Starbucks coffee were off the lobby up until maybe 9 p.m. and the bartender in the tiny bar area was amazing taking orders and running the bar. Happy hour not a great deal on the wine but the food items were half off for that short time. (Grilled shrimp yummy!). Refridgerator in the room always a winner in my book. The airport shuttle guys were so accommodating by giving me a lift to the Sheraton which was across from the airport each of the three mornings and my husband picked me up each day. No need to pay the $20.00 all day parking at the conference. Room was clean, furniture in excellent shape and lots of plugs to charge all the electronics. Would stay again even if not in town for business as hotels in downtown charge ridiculous fees to park and noise levels great if near Petco and Gaslight streets. It's less than 10 mins. drive to Horton Plaza and this location even has a Subway, Starbucks and Mexican Restaurant across the parking lot from the hotel next door. Lots of free parking and the free shuttle if flying into San Diego can't be beat! Can't find one thing I didn't like and I am a picky traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: MommaTrain
Reviews.Content: Will stay here again! Great modern decor. Clean. Great breakfast and cafe. Good hot tub. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: POLICEDOG
Reviews.Content: Spent 4th of July there and had a great time We will be back again Great Location,staff was very nice parking was real bad on the 4th of July and another guest paid no attention and snuck their dog into the place via a side door

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dineandwinelady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our family. The highlights: -Amazing esplanade trail with park along the trail that our kids loved, and mom loved jogging along every morning -Balcony overlooking pool was very relaxing and great views -Staff were all very friendly -Pool and outdoor fireplace area were great -Trader Joe's and Von's grocery stores super-close for beach supplies and groceries -Starbucks and restaurants right in the adjoining retail area -breakfast buffet was also delicious with friendly service. Omlettes made to order, waffles made to order, oatmeal with all the fixings, and fresh scrambled eggs and bacon etc... - the bar area was also very nice. -close to all the attractions, as far as freeway access and main street access. Cons: - maybe the airplanes were a little noisy, it didn't bothder us at all... But it is close to the Airport -the elevator was slow. We ended up taking the stairs most of the time which isnt a bad choice. Overall a really friendly, convenient, nice hotel GREAT for families and other travelers. By far the nicest Courtyard I've ever stayed at. Stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: lauramillertexas
Reviews.Content: This was a super hotel for the price. The service was amazing. One concierge, Thomas, even remembered our name and greeted us as we walked by. He also switched us to a room closer to the pool and the staff even moved our bags for us! The rooms were clean & the pool/patio was really lovely. Very quiet, almost "resort" atmosphere compared to other options. Walkable to a nice playground, Trader Joe's, and restaurants. I would recommend eating at Tender Greens while you're there. Lots of nice little extras such as watermelon juice every evening in the lobby. Unlike at most hotels in this price range, the concierges were super knowledgeable and provided us with great maps and information. We would definitely stay here again when we are back in the San Diego area! The only thing that we would change is to have a complimentary continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location...”
Reviews.Author: Vedgi74
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews that we had read on tripadvisor, and we have to say that we were not disappointed. The hotel had a full and contintental breakfast that really hit the spot. The rooms were clean, the laundry room was more than adequate and the staff were very friendly. The hotel is very close to the airport and very close to downtown. We were also excited to find that there were two grocery stores (Trader Joes and Vons) just a vew short blocks away. The restaurants in the area, Tender Greens, Sushiya and Oggi's Pizza and Brewing were excellant. Overall, two thumbs up from my family. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: Terri17-17
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. The location is perfect, close to attractions and beaches. No charge for parking! I hope it stays that way! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. There was a family reunion going on, and we will be looking in to having ours there too in 2013. The courtyard area is beautiful, and you can walk on a boardwalk right out the back door. The restaurant breakfast was delicious and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kparker528
Reviews.Content: We once again chose to go to Comic Con and stay at Liberty Square. It is located close to everything. The staff and management are wonderful.. Kurt the manager made our stay so welcoming and truly went the extra mile to help resolve a mistake Comic Con made in our room reservations. We can't thank him enough. The restaurant in the hotel is also wonderful with a great chef.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a conveniant location”
Reviews.Author: fender418
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in June. The property is new and well maintained. The location couldn't be better. The neighborhood is new and about 5 min from downtown. The rooms are a little smaller than they show in the website pictures but other than that they were very clean. We even had a balcony with a bay view which the front desk was able to get for us when we asked. There is plenty of free parking and airport noise wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Funky_Jim29
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in San Diego many times but Tripadvisor hit one out of the park with this one. The customer service was excellent. The hotel is close to downtown by car. The free parking makes a big difference since everywhere else in San Diego seems to charge for it. Who arrives without a car in San Diego? The front desk staff, specifically Stephanie and Thomas, were amazing. The hotel is relatively new and fresh. The airport is close by but I didn't really notice the planes that much since they are not directly overhead. The grounds are excellent for walking and the new Liberty Station area is cool, in a suburban sort of way. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TheSecretVagabond
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and we would enthusiastically recommend it. We booked a two night stay in the beginning of July using Marriott rewards points. This is by far the nicest Courtyard I've ever seen. It, and the complex in which it's located, seem fairly new. Located along the esplanade, there's a great trail that runs along a river-like body of water behind the hotel that was great for morning walks. Starbucks and multiple quick service restaurants are in the same parking lot, just a five minute walk from the doors of the hotel. The room was spacious and clean. The main tourist attractions of San Diego are just minutes away. The hotel is in a quiet area; even the overhead planes did not disturb us.The pool area was very nice for a Courtyard and my kids. ages 8 and 5-turning-6-on this trip, loved that it was only 3-4 feet deep and never crowded. All this plus free wifi, free coffee, and personable and professional employees made this an exceptional property. Forgot to mention parking was free-- we paid $25 or more to park at some hotels on our trip up the coast

Reviews.Title: “Liberty Station”
Reviews.Author: notam787
Reviews.Content: Arrived from New York with Delta great flight Picked up the courtesy phone and within 10 minutes the Hotel Shuttle was there jump on board for the 10 minute ride to the Marriott Great location on inlet to the harbour Plenty to see and do in San Diego we only had 2 days so a little pushed for time, and of course we headed for the San Diego Zoo enjoyed it all day. Had 2 evening meals at the Marriott very good indeed, Very Clean Hotel with enjoyable lawns and easy scenic walks around the area. A short cab ride into the city for a little shoppingbefore driving up to Long Beach and The Queen Mary, Grat new Toll way made the drive easy for an Australia, even though you have to drive on the opposte side of the road to us simple Australians

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay all around”
Reviews.Author: wanderingj
Reviews.Content: We held our family reunion at this beautiful hotel and it was a complete success. Our thanks to the wonderful staff in every department for making this hotel a great choice. We could not have been more pleased and will absolutely be back, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “You could call this a Courtyard Plus”
Reviews.Author: MFRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is a bit more than your typical Courtyard, as it has a resturant with room service, a deli, conference center, and a full bar, along with a larger pool area. It's more of an inbetween a full Marriott & a normal Courtyard, hence the Courtyard Plus I'm calling it. As mentioned in the other reviews, the rooms are very nice at this property and they keep it up amazingly well. I had to ask how old the property was, and was amazed they said 4 years old as it looked like it was a brand new & they just finished everything a few months ago. About the only drawback to this hotel is it's location. It is in a good central location, but at the same time it's not close to anything except the airport. So expect to make a bunch of 5-10 min. drives to most items. Or go park near the Old Town trolley station & ride the trolleys. That's the best way to go downtown. Two items. Jim the bar manger/bartender is a master at classic cocktails as he spent 30+ years at the Del Coronado as a bar manager and is way above what you would expect to find at a business hotel. The other is the hotel will take you on the shuttle bus to any of the resturants on the Shelter Island/Harbor Island area. Highly recommend the Bali-Hi, With the restoration, the view & the high quality food it's a great Tiki Temple, and Jimmy's Famous American Tavern is basically across from the Holiday Inn about a 1/4 mi. away is a fantasic gastropub & has a nice harbor view. Very cool decor as well and great if you want a causal dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great and in a beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: BiznessTraveler2
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice Courtyard in an above average part of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: osubarry
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel right on the water. It has a park directly next door and a walking path out past the pools. Hotel staff were excellent although the breakfast staff looked short staffed. The desk staff were very friendly and welcoming. The pools were beautiful. Great location, quick 5 minute drive to Point Loma, Seaport Village, Gaslamp District, Petco Park, etc. Internet was free and rooms were spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls but Clean”
Reviews.Author: 1CrazyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a Sea World weekend trip. We were in rooms #337 and #339. Both rooms were clean and had a nice view. The only downside was the noise coming from upstairs. The people upstairs slammed doors and moved furniture (my best guess) until 1AM and started up again at 6AM. Upon check out, I let the front desk know and they apologized and told me I should've called them. Unfortunately, I did not have the energy after a long day at Sea World. In the future, I would either request a room on the top floor, or for light sleepers, try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in Beautiful Area!”
Reviews.Author: pinlow
Reviews.Content: Loved this Marriott's contempory modern design and upscale boutique rooms. Great location near Sea World and all San Diego attractions. Quiet location on the bay but near pleanty of restaurants. Nice views, walking paths, spa and pool. There is a great breakfast buffet or McDonalds is just down the road. Our teenager loved the sofa coach. We look forward to our next stay here when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Around...still fanastic!”
Reviews.Author: morphius909
Reviews.Content: First visit was in January. Now, in July, this place is still very very nice! Ample Free Parking. Fast checkin. Very Very clean rooms and modern as well (it's a fairly new hotel!) For fourth of July they had some festivities and in the evening the hotel was the perfect location for watching the SD fireworks! Located beside a nice park and walking path. You're also not far from a nice district which includes VONS, Trader Joes, Five Guys, etc etc. Fast Free Wi-Fi as well. Definitely my choice, business or pleasure, in SD!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sagegl
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Has an outdoor pool for the kids. Located on the water with a nice walking path and park out back.
