On weekends a company comes and gives free paddle board lessons to hotel guests. I had a room on the first floor, much less noise than the upper floors. Keurig in room was convenient. Hotel also offered free coffee and tea bar in lobby along with refreshing citrus waters and juices. Was able to walk out back and watch three different firework displays on the fourth. Friendly staff, remembered our names. Would definitely stay here again. Also we had the breakfast special with room- great food! Omelets to order, waffles, oatmeal, cereals. Just a wonderful place, very family oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: chumleyetta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! Right on the water, great walking paths along the water. Very nice pool and lounge area overlooking the water. This is a great place to stay and explore San Diego. It is close to the airport so you will hear the planes, but the location, surrounding area, and hotel is so awesome it's all worth it. Great places to eat and shop very close by. Staff was very helpful, half priced happy hour, well stocked coffee bar, and quiet! We had a room overlooking the courtyard between the two hotels located there....it was great! Can't think of any negatives to this place. If we ever have the chance to be in San Diego again, we will stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Funtasticfour11
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 6 and were checked in right away. The front desk was friendly. We did not get help offered to take our bags with a bell hop and that was o.k. with us. (Save money on tips). It does not appear that they have one regularly anyways. The room had a balcony and a view overlooking the pool and the rest of the bay. The area is a military navy area so very interesting area. You definitely don't hear the airplanes. We really liked the balcony feature to let in fresh air. The weather was not what we expected. It was in the 70's which was o.k. The pool was nice and clean. The breakfast buffet is sufficient with lots to choose from, would recommend. A nice perk is the free internet and FREE parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fathers Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: HummerDad
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked into the door of this hotel the staff was warm, caring and welcoming... Rooms were perfect, didn't find a single thing wrong with them. Restaurant food was great, service was perfect... Housekeeping was late getting to our room on Saturday, but that is expected when you are sold out... My 7 yr old daughter lost her brand new Sea World cup in the Restaurant during breakfast on Saturday. She went down and spoke to Aaron and David at the front desk, they took the matter seriously (Coming from a 7 yr old) and searched for the cup, calling staff members who worked in the morning and come up with the cup... What hotel does that anymore except maybe a Ritz-Carlton...lol Hotel is close to everything, Downtown San Diego, Sea World, Mission Beach. I cant think of anyplace else I want to stay on my next trip to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: BRIT56
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Diego and due to other reviews on Trip Advisor we chose this hotel and do not regret it one bit. Where to begin. If required they do have an Airport Shuttle. We had a room on the 4th Floor overlooking The Courtyard and Bay. It was clean and the bed was very comfy. There are lots of restaurants in walking distance but the hotel restaurant is also great and you can eat at the bar. Very reasonable. We had the Buffet Breakfast which is one of the best we have had in a hotel in a long time. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Jim is excellent in the bar and adds to a great night. Kurt on the front desk is very knowledgable and helpful. Impressed overall with the staff. Beautiful pathways to walk/jog, we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: atlantic2580
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night and had a good stay. Hotel was styled different than other Courtyards. It looked like a Mexican-styled building. It was situated on the bay in an upscaled neighborhood. It was close to the airport and there was a shopping center next door which had several restaurants. The hotel overall was clean and looked brand new. I had a King bed room and it was typical Courtyard styling. It had a big king bed, a decent size fridge, and big bathroom. There was no microwave, so I had to use the one in the one lobby. The bathroom vanity was one of the biggest ones I've seen. I requested a top floor corner room and was given one. I did noticed the floors weren't as strong as other Courtyards, so noise maybe an issue on lower floors. My biggest pet peeve is doors slamming hard, but they tensioned the doors to where it would slowly and softly close. Behind the hotel was a nice walking/running area where you can enjoy the nice San Diego weather. Overall this was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Car01
Reviews.Content: We chose the Marriott Liberty Station for our recent stay in San Diego because it was a little out of town and hoped it would provide a peaceful location for our holiday with good access to all the sights of San Diego. We certainly weren't disappointed, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The King-sized room (room 438) was huge, with a large bathroom and small balcony. Bed was super-comfy and although close to the airport, we heard almost no noise during our stay. There was a small fridge in the room, and a Keurig-style coffee maker, but no in-room safe which was a bit of a hassle (free lock-boxes are provided at reception). All the staff were friendly and very good at their jobs; nothing seemed too much trouble. It would help if the instructions on how to summon the shuttle bus from the airport were clearer. As it was, I called reception on a payphone and they dispatched the bus straight away, but we couldn't find any directions or a free phone (other hotels have this sorted). We took breakfast on a few mornings, and this was pretty good value for an unlimited selection of either continental, or hot items. During the day, free coffee is available near reception, as well as huge containers of chilled juices. There's also an on-site laundry which was reasonably priced at $1.25 per machine (free soap from reception). The surrounding area is gorgeous, and there's a Trader Joes and Vons supermarkets within easy walking distance. Buses into downtown leave from the main road opposite Starbucks every half-hour (not Sundays, and only hourly via the airport on Saturdays), but there's another bus route towards the trolley interchange which leaves from Rosecrans Street. We bought a 3-day MTS unlimited pass and this was really useful for exploring San Diego (good for buses and trolleys). Overall, a great hotel in a stunning location. We'd go back in an instant given half the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: jarubies
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay at this Marriott. We needed somewhere to stay the night between flights- this was close, had a shuttle and I knew I couldn't go wrong with a Marriott. We were not disappointed! The pool was nice and heated and the whirlpool spa was great. The rooms were beautifully decorated and the beds were so comfy, very sound proof. We did not get to use it but the fitness room was large and had lots of equipment. We tried a restaraunt nearby called Oggis Brewery- sooooo good, well priced and and had a huge menu. Our experience here was wonderful and we would never hesitate to choose Marriott again!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but friendly, clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Bosseler
Reviews.Content: Marriott stands for great, clean hotels, which was also confirmed in this case. I had to wait for a friend one night and was looking for an appropriate place to stay. I found the Courtyard by Marriott, meeting all my expectation: spacious room, very clean, great service and excellent breakfast. The only drawback is the expensive price, but I would still recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, clean, clean, clean.”
Reviews.Author: CaseyNorthridge_Ca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 2 kids, this place is very cozy, clean, and has friendly and very responsive staff. we asked for extra blankets and they were brought to our room within minutes; this would have taken much longer at other hotels. everything is very clean in this place, and you will see crew cleaning all the time. They have a great place for breakfast, and ours was included in the room price, my kids loved the breakfast, too. This hotel is excellent value for the price, but the rooms are small, and if you have more than two people in the room, it would probably be difficult. The sofa bed is not comfortable at all, so next time I would take a room with double beds instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Samiam2366
Reviews.Content: Rooms smelled and looked clean. Staff was very friendly. Hotel exterior is beautiful. There's an outdoor fireplace, pool and hot tub. Just behind hotel is a path. Surroundings are very serene and beautifully landscaped. Beds were especially comfortable and hotel is quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again. Within walking distance is a Trader Joes, Vons (grocery) and plenty of restaurants. Very close to airport, but not loud!

Reviews.Title: “An easy stopover hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Marais72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a quick visit to San Diego and Seaworld. I chose it because it was Number 1 on TripAdvisor at the time and was well reviewed. Its a great stopover hotel, near the airport and Seaworld 10 minutes away, service was great, hotel very clean, but it is a basic no frills stay and has a small outdoor pool. It was our first visit to San Diego so quite difficult to compare to any other hotels in the area. If you are driving there from LA, we stopped at Del Mar were there are some great restaurants looking on to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the marriott”
Reviews.Author: mss09
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, nice friendly staff. Thanks Stephanie for the advice on the Italian restaurant, was right on! Free shuttle to and from the airport was great because we didn't rent a car during our stay. Will definitely stay here again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice courtyard”
Reviews.Author: MontanaKim
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The room was extremely clean, quiet, comfortable and nicely-decorated. The area surrounding the hotel is very nice and it is conveniently located. The service was great. The breakfast buffet (12.50/adult) included an omelet station and was well-stocked and delicious. Free parking and free wireless as well!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Great Food”
Reviews.Author: akmom8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband & our two children, ages 2 & 6. The purpose of our stay was to visit Seaworld & the beach. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms are modern, the room/bathroom was clean and the staff is wonderful. Even the two restaurants and Starbucks coffee bar were excellent! I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: drivinggirl
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard was the nicest one we have ever stayed in. Our room was small but the hotel is new and very up to date and clean. It has a lovely water location with pool and a great breakfast. We had received breakfast in our package. We stayed one night after a long flight and their free shuttle had stopped running and they picked up our tab for the cab--very nice! The front desk staff provided directions for sightseeing and were very friendly. A real winner!

Reviews.Title: “greal location near airport, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Marvin84
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from the airport and they were prompt in picking us up and returning us to the airport. The staff was efficient and friendly. A good place to stay if you need an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: dandkm88
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear one night after arriving at the airport. Clean, up to date. room with a nice balcony. very close tot he airport, but does not feel that way. Staff very helpful and friendly. Restaurant / bar in the lobby had great staff and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: paso57
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Liberty Station is an excellent choice for staying outside the downtown core. Rooms are clean and well appointed, with all of the electronic connections one could wish for. Free and fast Wi-Fi. Very friendly staff. In the Point Loma area, with easy access to downtown (adjacent to Harbor Drive), close to airport with free shuttle. Some aircraft noise at times, but not to the point of being a problem. Would definitely consider again when traveling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason why this hotel is listed as one of the top hotels in area!”
Reviews.Author: ATCole
Reviews.Content: Where to start?! Ok, I will describe this place from my personal experience. First off, I am still currently residing at this location for a long term stay and even after a month and a half I the staff all around has continuously gone out of their way, literally, to help me out with ANY personal issue or request I have had. If the amenities do not grab your attention the friendly staff most certainly will. Please do not let "friendly" be considered a loose term. Every staff member here is very personal and it is not because it is their job, but because they are warm and caring people and really do want you to enjoy your time here in San Diego. Every recommendation to every ridiculous request is spot on for everything I have ever needed. It is almost as if they cannot do enough to make sure your stay is wonderful. The food? Glad you asked! They have a wonderful array of options for breakfast, lunch (which i dine here for every day) and dinner. Outstanding steaks to half off happy hour appetizers to outstanding salads. I've even made absurd requests just as a test, which I do feel a little guilty for, and all have been met with a 5 star ending. Yes, five out of five. Oh, who likes hot tubs? I do! Nice glass of wine by the fireplace, ok, if you want to, it is available here. They even provide you with a ride to the surrounding areas for dining or entertainment and even to go shopping if you like. Also, as an extended stay guest, I was greeted with extra gifts to help me be as comfortable as possible. A big thanks goes out to the sales manager Bonnie for that. And to everyone at the front desk (Matt, Joe, Christina, Stephanie, Cara, Chris, Kurt, Jamie, Marlene, and don't worry, Sandy and Mitch I don't forget about you) thank you for being so awesome. Susan, thank you for the outstanding sandwiches for lunch, Jim, Anna, Sara, and Hector, thank you for the evening dining company and great service at the bar and restaurant, And Ms. Claudia, although you may or may not read this, you do an outstanding job with the room. If you are still reading this as a guide to find a place to stay, don't waste anymore time searching, this is the place you want. This is the place you deserve to come for business or pleasure. This is the place. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: bruno53
Reviews.Content: Great location, free parking and staff goes out of their way to be friendly. Great bartender during happy hour. Clean and up to date rooms and great food.

Reviews.Title: “This place is exceptional”
Reviews.Author: BJWca
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Staff outstanding, Location close to everything. Parking free. New, nice and clean. Good value, comfortable beds. Would stay here anytime we were in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: amusingdiva
Reviews.Content: Did a sister's get together at this hotel over President's Weekend. I agree with most of the other reviews. A few things: - This is a typical Marriott property. -Really nice & helpful staff. We felt welcomed every time we came through the doors. -Nice pool area with fire pit. We sat out in the sun a bit but was too cold to use the pool and it was small, not for swimming, more for dipping. -Great to have Trader Joe's & Von's nearby. We stocked our mini-fridge and ate breakfasts in the room. - Did not eat in the hotel restaurant or use the bar but we did eat at Sammie's Woodfired Pizza near Trader Joe's - excellent! - Nice walking path that goes past a Marina and down to Spanish Landing Park and beyond. Would be great if they had bikes available for use. - Airplanes do land and take off frequently but not until about 6:30 a.m. It was never loud enough to wake us up. - Free parking is a great perk. You will want a car here unless you do not mind walking a few miles to catch the trolley or to take a bus. The Old Town Trolley tour has a shuttle pick up next door at the Homewood Suite but they only pick up and drop off at a specified time per day. - We did not have a balcony but there was a decent park & water view ; there were a few rooms with balconies overlooking the water(I would guess those are the suites). - Room was spacious enough for two people and, other than some loud people coming in late, we had no troubles with noise. My only real complaint is it was not warm enough! I've stayed a few places in Sam Diego and so had my sister. So far we'd choose this place or Humphrey's Half Moon for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel w/ fantastic views and service & paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Yum E
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of a free night down here in San Diego. I'm not sure if the rack rate of $195 would be worth the money though... This Courtyard is right next to the San Diego airport and has breath-taking views. The property itself is in tip-top shape and the service at the front desk was top-tier. As a Gold member with Marriott, there was no acknowledgment, no free breakfast, and no free water in the room. Breakfast was $12.50 for the buffet and water was $2.50 per bottle. ...I did get a Marriott Elite room card and portfolio? Upon entering the room, the room looked very modern. However, there seemed to be a lot of fashion over form in the room. Unlike Hiltons, the bath towels, required you to step out of the shower and grab the towel from underneath the sink... Hilton's typically have the towels above the toilet or at the opposite end of the shower head! The bed was comfortable and looked nice...However the duvet itself was paper thin...just like the walls. Upon arriving into the room, the suite next door was having a huge party. ...A call to the front desk resulted the night manager and security guard to visit the suite next door... Throughout the night, I was able to enjoy hearing my neighbors closing their door with the auto-lock feature and everyone talking in the hallway...

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Nedruda
Reviews.Content: The service here is great. My husband and I did not rent a car we thought we would just use taxis. We wanted to eat somewhere local so we asked the front desk to call us a cab. Instead they offered us the use of the shuttle. When we were done eating we called the hotel and the shuttle picked us up right away.

Reviews.Title: “Why are the walls so thin?”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSpy
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight using a Marriott Rewards free night certificate. The hotel still feels brand new, the esplanade at the back of the hotel is very relaxing, and it's great to find a hotel in San Diego with complimentary parking. If I was flying out of the San Diego airport, this would be at the top of my list. But...I was woken up at 6AM on a Sunday to the sounds of the guests next door blow-drying their hair and having friends come in/out of the room while they were getting ready. It sounded as though this was all happening inside my room!! I was just glad that I was able to fall back asleep. It was a shame that the walls here are so thin; it's a nice Courtyard otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: JDandND
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days in the San Diego area and this Marriott was our home base. No hassle free parking and easy access to the surrounding areas. The hotel offers shuttle services but we feel that having a car is necessary.The rooms were modest in size but offered all conveniences and were very clean. The pool area was comfortable and there is an adjacent park with areas for walking or jogging. There are a few casual restaurants and food markets within walking distance. This Marriott is a great value versus the pricier downtown alternatives. We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough - Not one of the best”
Reviews.Author: jreilly2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business. Location was convenient to airport and the places I had to get to. Newer building in good condition, but elevator was painfully slow. Also painfully slow was the internet access, with many drop-outs. 20th century technology, I suspect. Good thing it was free. Did not get a chance to use restaurant; it was closed the only night of my stay that I was going to use it. Not too far from Little Italy, so it worked out OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, friendly and professional!”
Reviews.Author: pickypickypicky
Reviews.Content: We stay at a lot of Marriotts but had not considered this one as when we are in San Diego it is usually for a conference. Their airport shuttle runs on the half hour from 4:30 AM but they will come get you if you call! It is located in a very clean, safe urban park-like setting, 1 long mile from the airport, complete with Subway, Starbucks, a sushi place, other hotels (Hilton) etc. all clean and quiet. As there is a city noise restriction in place the sound of planes during sleeping hours is minimal. I stayed two nights and never heard anyone in adjoining rooms. The hotel is very modern, staff were friendly even at 3:30 AM departure, there is a free business center, free internet, free parking, bar, & restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: ws_leung
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Dec 2010 while we were visiting San Diego - wished we stayed longer! The hotel is situated in an old Navy training facility and the place (Liberty Station) felt like a nice little small town. There's a Safeway closeby if we need to grab water and snacks before we head back to the hotel. We asked for a room with a view of the water and we woke up to sunny blue skies and the ocean - perfection! The hotel is very clean and well kept. We asked for dining recommendations around town from the staff and they are very helpful. There's a nice pool and jacuzzi but too bad the December weather is too chilly for us to enjoy the facilities. Parking is no issue and free. If we visit San Diego in the future we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Pitty the Thinness of Walls”
Reviews.Author: morphius909
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great 4 night stay in san Diego. This hotel is very modern, clean, efficient and affordable. The Property is very well kept and the rooms and public areas are fairly spotless. Kudos to the cleaning staff. Highspeed internet (Wireless and Wired ) is complimentary. YOu got a nice 1 shot coffee maker in the suit, nice LCD TV, and nice bathroom. My only gripe was the thinness of the walls. And no I am not speaking about Airplane Noise (Which you do hear but you quickly learn to ignore). I meant the room to room discussions you can easily hear. I stay around 60-100 nights/year in hotels and this was easily the thinnest walls I've ever heard. It was very strange. The first night my wife and I had essentially front row seats to a lady discussing her failing marriage on the phone. Wow. clear as a bell! Other then that, nice place to stay. Lots of restaurants nearby, Park beside the hotel, VONS grocery store a few block away. A vehicle is a must BTW!

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean, good location, friendly staff. no criticisms.”
Reviews.Author: philipellis
Reviews.Content: we (myself and early 20 year old daughters) stayed in this hotel for 11 nights over christmas and the new year. the friendly welcome we received after a long flight from london and then a drive from los angeles to san diego set the tone for what was to be a great stay. the highest praise I can give of this hotel is that when we were out in san diego, or travelling to L.A. or overnighting in Vegas, the phrase we all used about returning to this Hotel was "let's go home". I believe that the first and major measure of a hotel (above location and price) is cleanliness; this hotel was spotlessly clean; the bedrooms, pool area, restaurant and lobby were immaculate; the towels and bedding were crisp, clean and comfortable. we were given two interconnecting rooms on the second floor with a good view over the pool and bay. the rooms were spacious, airy and the bathrooms were a good size, with good toiletries and plenty of towels. the rooms were cleaned every day (apart from christmas day when just the bins were emptied). the hotel is a very close to the airport (at most a five minute drive) and there is a frequent free shuttle to the airport; we used this when we over nighted in vegas and on our return we contacted the hotel to send the shuttle to collect us; this worked brilliantly and the shuttle was waiting for us as we exited the terminal. the airport is much busier than I thought and there was some noise in our bedrooms from planes taking off and landing, but no real inconvenience or disturbance the hotel is on a modern complex, alongside a hilton,a number of restaurants, a starbucks and a massage spa ( Envy - $50 for a full hour long massage - brilliant); the only thing lacking was a convenience store on the site. however, there is a very small mini shop behind the reception in the hotel. there is loads of free parking (the internet is also free as is use of the desktop computers in the lobby where we printed our airline boarding cards). the hotel also accepted a couple of faxes on our behalf (again free of charge; I recall being charged $20 for a fax at the bellagio several years ago!) location of the hotel is good; a couple of minutes from the airport and maybe double that to down town san diego and the midway. the drive to the fantastic zoo (where my kids fed the giraffes; available every day between 12pm and 1 pm- unmissable) took 10 - 15 mins. the price of our stay at the hotel was ok - we paid maybe a little more than we expected, but when you add on free parking ( another hotel we considered down town wanted $30 per night to park) and the free internet, the price was about right. there are no safes in the room, but I used a safe box behind reception for the duration of our stay (although there wasn't much left to put into it towards the end of the holiday), and again this was free of charge. I don't get the impression that in the san diego we saw petty crime is a problem. we ate in the hotel a couple of nights; the restaurant had virtually shut down other than for breakfast over the holiday season, but the restricted menu and the food we chose from it and ate in the bar area were pretty good and reasonably priced a holiday in san diego in the winter is the epitome of cool, and the laid back friendly tone of this beautifully clean hotel means that we'll be more than happy to "come home" here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation for a Young Family - - and a GREAT LOCATION to boot!”
Reviews.Content: By far the BEST location and hotel experience for a young family like ours - - where proximately to all the great things in San Diego is important (Balboa Park, Seaport Village, etc.), but totally WITHOUT the hustle and bustle "rat race" of the city. (And close to some great restaurants - - Jimmy's - - as well as grocers like Trader Joe's). We are definitely coming back to this hotel when the kids are old enough to enjoy Sea World and the Zoo! Hands down! Although our hotel room was no where near ready upon or arrival (as we had selected only one of the three suites on property, the day after New Years Eve celebrations at the hotel - - late check outs, etc), our love for the extra room in the suite with our new family was key. The mini-fridge, pull out couch/family room, and great view of the water at sunrise was a welcome touch. (And we loved the little Kuereg coffee machine to get us going in the morning.) But by far - - the ability to just get out and walk along the water, enjoy the history and patriotism of the Liberty Station naval training area, and sampling any number of the great food around the hotel was the perfect combination. One suggestion - - our personal vehicle was key, as this location is just far enough away from key locales, that having your own transportation was a must in our book. It worked out great, as the access to N Harbor Dr, Rosecrants, and the 5 & 8 freeways was a breeze. Also... the staff is short handed from Dec 30th - Jan 9th... so beware of such "lite" times, as we did find that some amenities were closed (or slow and cumbersome) on property. I am sure at full speed, you would never know. Thanks to the staff for stepping up where we needed them to on our first night... Joe (Manager), Evelyn (Front Desk), Jim (Restaurant), and especially Anna (Restaurant)....thanks!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: bonkenmom
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Location is fantastic. Nice area. Every person we came in contact with that worked here was helpful, friendly and just genuinely nice. Hotel is convenient to Airport, Sea World, Pacific Beach, Downtown. Good buffet breakfast at a reasonable price with omelets and waffles made to order. Free Starbucks coffee all day in the lobby area. Quiet hotel. Although close to Airport, only really heard airplanes during day. When we went to sleep we didn't hear planes at all. Park nearby. Definitely recommend this place to stay when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: Conner2dood
Reviews.Content: Reserved room for a pre-cruise stay after seeing great recommendations on Trip Advisor Hotel is located in new development 5 minutes from airport. Yes, it is a beautiful , well run hotel situated in a park-like area on the Bay. However, it is far, far from anything you might want to do in San Diego. No public transportation near-by It is a $20-$40cab ride to any San Diego attraction. Several restaurants in area were empty and I walked 10 blocks through two school zones to find a grocery store. If I had a car, it would a perfect stay, buy without your own transportation, you are fairly well isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mn55406
Reviews.Content: The hotel was able to check us in early... The moment we walked into the room we were happy. Much better deal than the Marriott gas lamp. The beds were foam and absolutely perfect. I agree the coffee maker was a nice change from the not so great mini coffee makers others have, but the beauty was in the comforts. Great for a family of four with two little kids. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: jenniferr12
Reviews.Content: This was definitely a very nice Courtyard. Updated rooms with comfortable beds. Excellent on-site amenities like the ice cream and coffee cafe, outdoor patio and fire pit, and nice location near park, walking trails, and restaurants. The breakfast buffet although not included in the room rate, was excellent. My experience would have been near perfect had our adjoining rooms been in a better location. The selection of adjoining rooms at this hotel is not great, and even though my husband has status with Marriott, we didn't get a great room placement - our rooms were on the first floor very close to the lobby, and with a view of the main entrance and no patio. I would have loved to have been on the water side with a balcony. We have young children who still nap, so I was hoping to have a nice place (with some fresh air) to hang out while they napped. But regardless, this is definitely as nice as others have said. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jcdjcdcVancouver
Reviews.Content: Service by the staff at check in and check out was fantastic and excellent. Rooms are comfortable and enjoyable. Slight annoyance with aircraft noise. Maid service over the top. Noisy guests in the hall was a slight annoyance. Breakfast offered by the hotel was good - Serving staff in restaurant rated an average rating; they just seemed to treat it as a job. Overall, loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Daughter's Wedding Was Perfect!"”
Reviews.Author: MCollett
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Airport/Liberty Station offers an excellent, elegant and very reasonable wedding venue! We were amazed at the magnificent and perfect wedding the Marriott provided for our daughter's wedding. The cocktail hour for the wedding is on a lovely Bayside Terrace. The Marriott is located on 46 acres of greenbelt and walking trail, along a channel of the San Diego Bay. The staff is excellent, dedicated and shows pride in service. Again, it is a very reasonable wedding venue with outstanding food, ambiance and value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lived up to the excellent reviews”
Reviews.Author: Beachdreams2
Reviews.Content: I always use TripAdvisor for trip planning and hotel selection, and the waterfront location and good reviews for the Courtyard Liberty Station -- which also was recommended on another forum I follow where people generally hold negative opinions about the Courtyard brand -- captured my attention. This hotel was everything I expected and more. I was looking for a Marriott family hotel (Category 4 or lower) to redeem two free night certificates, and this hotel was a really good choice. It has been many years since I stayed at a Courtyard property, and I found the Courtyard Liberty Station to have a new, modern feel, which I really liked, and a lot more amenities than I would expect at a Courtyard. All the hotel personnel we interacted with were friendly, professional, and helpful. The location was great with direct access to a walking trail along the water, proximity to the airport, availability of several dining options at the hotel and within Liberty Station, and pretty easy access to the freeways for getting around the San Diego area. Rooms: I have Gold elite status in the Marriott Rewards program, but Iâ€™m not someone who pushes or even asks for room upgrades. When I booked the room (by phone), the agent did ask for my room preferences, and they were met (two beds, higher floor, good view). We had a great view of the pool and the water/walking path. The room was well designed, attractive, and a good size. Furniture included two queen-size beds, a chair/lamp in a corner for reading or looking at the view, a desk/desk chair with a sliding table underneath it, and a dresser/credenza. The room was equipped with a single-brew Keurig coffee maker (coffee/tea were provided and replenished daily) and small refrigerator, nice flat screen TV, wired and wireless internet, and other electronic hookups. The bathroom had a single sink but a large vanity that was great for two women travelling together. Linens and towels seemed to be pretty good quality (nicer towels than some of the Marriott extended stay properties I have stayed this year). Staff/service: We (my sister and I) arrived separately. My sister, who is not a very experienced traveler, had an easy time getting to the hotel (using the hotelâ€™s complimentary shuttle from the San Diego airport) and having the hotel store her luggage (repeated on her departure day since she had a red eye flight and I left earlier to return to LAX with the rental car). Our room was cleaned in the morning while we were out for a walk. We were able to check in a little early, and we were able to get a slightly extended checkout. Front desk staff members were helpful and professional whenever we spoke to them. Property Amenities: The hotel had a nice outdoor seating area and a outdoor pool/jacuzzi (didnâ€™t use because of the weather), fitness room with Life Fitness equipment (multi-station weight machine and several pieces of cardio equipment), full service restaurant and snack bar/deli type place (didnâ€™t try either), three computers and a printer available for guest use, and probably other things that I didnâ€™t notice or use. The public areas were attractive and functional. There was plenty of parking, and it was free. Feel free to send me a private message if there are any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Best place I've ever stayed in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: wrs1106
Reviews.Content: Having stayed several times in the downtown/harbor front area, and once in Mission Valley, I would have to say that this was my favorite place Iâ€™ve ever stayed in San Diego! The hotel is in the Liberty Station area, which is the old Naval Recruit Training Center. This area has retail shops, a Vonâ€™s Grocery, a Trader Joeâ€™s, and restaurants too numerous to mention, including the fabulously fun Corvette Diner. There is 46-acre park (NTC Park, always brimming with activity) adjacent to the hotel, and a beautiful walkway (The Esplanade) along the waterfront, which is a boat channel off of San Diego Bay. We took advantage of the walkway to get in our exercise, and to enjoy the gorgeous weather that San Diego offers. The only â€œnegativeâ€� is that the airport is so close, you can see and hear the planes taking off every few minutes during the day. We didnâ€™t hear any late at night, so Iâ€™m assuming that no flights go in and out of Lindbergh Field overnight. This hotel is pretty new, so everything is in great condition, both inside and outside. There is a full-service restaurant, a bar with three large screen TVâ€™s for the sports fans, and a deli, where you can get Starbuckâ€™s Coffee, sandwiches and salads, and breakfast pastries. The room dÃ©cor was very modern, efficient, and comfortable. All of the staff members we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful and, staying there five nights, we never had a single complaint. I would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Diego. I think you will be able to see from my pictures that the hotel property and surrounding area are top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: California1078
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised by this hotel. We stayed in 3 other hotels on our trip (starting in San Francisco) and this was our last stop. Had we stayed here first we would have been very disappointed by the other hotels. This hotel was so clean and beautiful. We never wanted to leave !!! The room exceeded my expectations by far !!! The hotel was close to everything we wanted (airport, car rental return, downtown, zoo). The landscaping was beautiful and there were plenty of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: DomCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October in a room with two beds on 3rd floor. Pros: - new hotel with large and very comfortable rooms - even though close to the airport it's still very quiet at night - great value for money - good breakfast (extra, but not expensive) Cons: - not right in the centre of San Diego but only a quick 5-10 min drive to downtown While in San Diego we definitely recommend visiting San Diego Zoo!

Reviews.Title: “It was a good place to crash”
Reviews.Author: jessejamesthe4th
Reviews.Content: This was a comfortable place to stay for the night as we made our way up the coast. We didn't spend much time at the motel but it was clean and the staff were nice. Typical hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “screwed by san diego high rollers, they padded our bills, see below.”
Reviews.Author: twinkletoesSarcoxie
Reviews.Content: I will just list the negatives, there were positives but the negatives made up for any positives. 1. Elevators were inoperative on several occasions. Security at one point took over a evelator and ejected the people, when they finally let them back in and departed it still did not work. Room service was not performed until after 4:00PM They attempted to charge for a movies not ordered or watched On one night the hospitality room was miserable due to noise from a band in the ajoining room. They promised adequate room for the Saturday banquet, they put 108 people in a room that should have only held 72. (according to submited plan in the initial planning stages) Excuse, they could not clear the ajoining room in time for the banquet. They charged the Association for 40 gallons of coffee at $40.00/gal. Coffee at the free breakfast was to have been included free. It is impossible for the consumption of that much coffee, my only conclusion is they poured it down the drain. The vast majority of the attendees were not at the hotel between the hours of 9:00AM and 3:00PM. Gratuity was excessive, 947.00 , I give on the basis of service beyone the normal. I will be warning other organizations of these "tricks of the trade" by Marriott hotels by scanning magazines advertising reunions and meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably nice”
Reviews.Author: ttraveler401
Reviews.Content: After spending three nights at the Hotel del Coronado, I moved to the Marriott Liberty Station the night before an early morning flight. Frankly, my stay here was better than the Hotel del: - the rooms were well appointed, spacious, new and clean; - there was no charge for parking, nor was there a resort fee; - the Internet access was speedy; - I was easily able to print off my boarding pass for free; - the pool area was clean; - the staff was friendly; and - it was great value for the cost. The only negative: I did hear jet noise from planes landing, but it wasn't too bad. I would recommend this hotel to others staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Cozy, and Close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: thebellcaptain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights the weekend of the 10th. We were extremely pleased with our stay. We arrived at 1pm, and they have a room with the harbor view ready for us. The room was well configured - with the bed facing the balcony. Also had a couch, desk, and flat-screen TV. My husband fell in love with the coffee machine in the room, though for some reason they only stocked decaf coffee in the room. Ice machine served up tasty ice (and it always worked). I recall reading some complaints about the towels, but I actually liked them - very lightweight and good for wrapping up your wet hair. Several times we visited the front desk to ask for directions to different venues, and we were always treated with courtesy. Kudos to the front desk. I was never worried about airport noise, as we live under the landing pattern of LAX. But, for those concerned about noise - yes, airplanes fly directly by the hotel, so you may want to take that into consideration if you wish no noise. Once you close your window, though, all the sounds are muffled. Unfortunately, we were unable to squeeze time in our stay to try out the pool, but we noticed a lot of kids enjoying it. The surrounding park and shops are very nice, with a very comfortable and safe walking path directly in front of the hotel itself. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Gem”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixreviewer
Reviews.Content: The location is just west of the airport. We had room 464 which faces the parking lot. Maybe odd numbered rooms face the bay/channel? There is a complimentary airport shuttle van.(we did not use it,we had a car) We had 2 queen beds in our room as a King was not available. The room had a nice desk area,LG flat screen TV with sleep time(many channels)r,phone on the desk and by the bed, a mini frig. and a Keurig coffee machine was near the entrance of the room. The room had very nice and new looking decor. There was a closet with an iron and ironing board in a cabinet. A full length mirror was near the entrance to the room. The bathroom was good size,not too big but not too small either. WI-FI is complimentary in the room as well as by the pool and throughout the hotel. There are 3 computers for guest use off the lobby near a fireplace room. Only 2 work for any internet and 1 reserved for getting boarding passes. It is a 24 hr. business center. There is a Waterside Deli(counter service) on the 1st floor serves lite breakfast and lunch. Hours are 5:30am to 7pm. There is a Breakfast buffet at twenty five-92 the inhouse restaurant M-F from 6:30am to 10am and Saturdays,Sundays, & holidays from 7am to 11am. The cost is $12.50 There is also a bar near this area with tv's. There is complimentary coffee at the Waterside deli. In room dining is daily from 5pm to 10pm. There is a outdoor pool and whirlpool and an outdoor firepit and fireplace. Everything on the hotel property is very well appointed. The lobby had watermelon juice and water flavored with lemons/limes a very nice touch which we enjoyed. This hotel has a conference center,many things going on the weekend we were there, but never felt too crowded,parking we thought would be a problem, but we found a space every time.(complimentary parking) There is a large park and walking path near the hotel,we enjoyed this. Benches along the way to reflect. The hotel is a little difficult to find. Once off Harbor Blvd., go through the mini shopping mall and you will see Homewood Suites first then Courtyard. If I am in the area again I would not hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: teamhunt4
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all the wonderful reviews. Great value and the location was great. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in handy situation for key attractions”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCov
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay for three nights at the MC in September. Rooms were spacious and clean which is why we regularly choose Marriott and the staff were helpful and mostly cheerful. Location is excellent with it's close proximity to the airport, harbour area, Downtown and Old Town plus as a bonus the Trolley Tour stops close to the hotel which is an excellent way to orientate onself to the layout of San Diego on your first day which is what we did. The Liberty Station dining opportunities are OK but not great. What is nice about this hotel is you can walk immediately by the waterways of SD which is great after the long flight from Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Contemporary Feel”
Reviews.Author: LH-California
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel with a modern contemporary feel. Nice pool/spa with a tropical grotto look. The hotel is near the airport and planes can be heard departing and taking off; thus, the name of the hotel. No planes took off during sleep hours, so we weren't bothered. That being said, our first floor room's bed was comfortable with quality linens. Spotless bathroom was spacious with granite countertop. Nicely appointed with numerous plugs and hook-ups for computers, etc. Enviable clock radio with i-pod docking station/recharger. The Kreuig coffee maker was just too complicated. (Whatever you do, don't use the coffee packet after you've poked a hole in it ... makes for a big mess and useless coffee). The staff was friendly and allowed us to check-in 30 minutes early. The Liberty Station is an interesting destination with the former Naval Training Center having been converted into shops, restaurants, and office spaces. Nice walking path adjacent to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful surroundings and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheOneWhoLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to airport, and yet you do not notice it: no noise or view on runways. Instead, the hotel has a view of a bay; a walking pass and a park surround the property. There are Liberty Station shops, restaurants, and stores nearby. The hotel is very clean and beautiful; parking is free The staff is friendly and helpful. The room had very nice decor, flat screen TV, complimentary internet, a refrigerator, soft duvet (the bed is bit hard), and large bathroom. They have a fitness center and an outside pool (did not swim due to weather and the meeting schedule). You can print from a room or at a free business center. The hotel has a restaurant and a coffee shop. The breakfast is ok: you can order an omelet (make sure the chef does not leave the oven area or risk your omelet to be overcooked) and there are some self-service items available; few berries. Aside that, the hotel is a really good choice to stay in San Diego when you have busy meetings and want to enjoy some tranquility afterwords. (It is not in downtown, which is good if you want to sleep at night and not to hear all emergency vehicles' sirens, train whistles, and music blaring till 3 am.)

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Courtyard Marriott has everything required for a perfect stay in this fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: calair9
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights in San Diego with friends & picked the hotel as Trip Advisor had it #1 in the city & there were not wrong!! nothing could be faulted from the room comfort, quiet location (altho close to the airport) & cleanliness of the hotel. The staff were also extremely friendly & helpfull The only slight downside is that you needed a car as there was no public trasport in the area but didn't affect us as we'd hired a car anyway & it's expected that you do ned one in the USA I'd fully recommend this hotel & will certainly use again next time we're back in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “MGMT CHOSE MAKING $ FROM LOUD EVENT OVER REGULAR GUESTS”
Reviews.Author: tryingtosubmit
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get away from the 107 degree heat in Phoenix and looked forward to a cool, tranquil weekend - HA! At 6 am Saturday we were shocked out of our sleep by a Band's drums. A triathlon was set up right next to the hotel. We could not walk on the sidewalks around the hotel because they were full of marathon runners - and this went on for HOURS because participants finished each part of the triathlon at varied times. upon contacting Stephanie at the front desk, she only pointed out how it was located there so they could advertise the hotel as a place to stay. Indeed this is true because I saw an ad from Courtyard on the SDTrClassic website offering them $115 a night rate. The lobby coffeeshop was also hoped to get more business. In other words, us regular customers paying full price were considered not as important as these rude runners. There was not even a place to park in the lot if you left and came back and entrances to the hotel were blocked so guests had to wait in a long line to come and go. All they would have had to do was have the event a little further down - many acres available as this is the former navy training and housing facility. ABSOLUTELY POOR MANAGEMENT!!!

Reviews.Title: “New. Clean. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: dd992emo
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at this hotel. I'm in SAN quite a bit for work and wanted to check this hotel out. Very new. Very clean. Good location. All the character of a dentist's office. I don't want to intrude on the lovefest, because the issues I mentioned are all good hotel indicators. It's just that I'm not feeling it for this place. Staff is efficient. Rooms are clean, but remind me a little of a hospital. Some airplane noise. Built in the midst of a yuppie commune that used to be the Naval Training Center. I'm going back to the CY Old Town. It has its issues, but it's just more my kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: susielondon79
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for mine and my husbands 10th Wedding Anniversary. We arrived on a flight from London, UK and called the hotel from the airport. Within 10 mins a friendly driver arrived to take us to the hotel. Upon arrival we were welcomed with smiling faces wishing us a Happy Anniversary (I had made a note of it on our booking). The hotel was very nice. Within walking distance to restaurants and our rooms was spacious and clean. As a keen runner I was pleased to see a large grass playing field next to the hotel and lovely walking path for training. The breakfast was amazing and enough food to last us most of the day! (Fresh fruit, nuts, cereals, made to order omelets, pancakes, waffles etc...). We did not have a car, but caught the hotel shuttle to the airport and then paid the $5 into town on the downtown bus. The hotel is out of town (it took about 30mins with the 2 buses), but the sea village was nice to visit and worth the trip. The views from the hotel were not as nice as I had hoped, but the hotel were able to meet my request of a nice pool view on the 3rd floor (as recommended on Trip Advisor) and that made up for it. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel and certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Valerie2270
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean and updated. I arrived early at 1:00 pm and my room was ready (Holiday Weekend). Pool was a little small (4 ft deep), but my kids enjoyed it. My husband enjoyed the jacuzzi. Nice bike path or running path next to hotel and takes you out next to Harbor. Wish I would have known and could have brought bikes. When we first got off fwy, Area didn't look too nice but as you get closer to Hotel and Harbor it was very nice. Didn't hear airplane noise when we were in the room. We were very happy with our room and the cost. They had a breakfast buffet for $13.00 we didn't stay for it. We went to IHOP and that wasn't so good (cost $60 for 5 of us), we should have just ate at the hotel. There are a couple of restaurants and a Starbucks next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: drkunk
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the majority of reviews of this Courtyard near the San Diego Airport were right on the money! Noise from the airport is not a factor. It was easy to find (driving), and the location turned out to be better than we could have hoped - not far from beaches, the SD Zoo, Sea World, downtown, etc. Liberty Station itself contained some stores and convenient restaurants for those in need of such a thing. I particularly enjoyed the walking paths, perfect for a morning walk along the water. There is a nice deli in the hotel, with lots of outside (and comfortable!) seating to enjoy the relaxed ambiance. The front desk staff were EXTREMELY helpful, in particular Cara, who should probably be given a raise just for all the advice she gave me! My only possible complaints would be the lack of variety in room types (something a little larger would have been helpful to us), and the somewhat slow internet connection (but free, as it always should be). I plan to stay here again when returning to San Diego (which I hope is soon!).

Reviews.Title: “Stop your search -- this is the place to stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: megleo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days with my family and my brother's family. Four adults and four kids aged 5 to 11. Everything about this hotel is superior. Literally everyone on staff met us with smiles and outstanding service. The rooms are spacious, lovely, clean and comfortable. Beds and pillows fantastic. Showers excellent. I didn't hear an airplane the entire time I was there, plus the area doesn't seem like it's near the airport -- not an industrial wasteland. On the contrary, it's right on the water next to a lovely walking/running path and marina. The restaurant is fantastic for breakfast and room service was fine, too (this from an excellent cook and overall food snob). Bar made a decent bloody Mary and featured a nice live jazz guitarist/singer. We all loved the pool/jacuzzi area after long days at Sea World and the zoo, both only minutes away. This is our new home base when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: jimdreaBoston
Reviews.Content: This place was great. I arrived Monday Agust 23 with my wife and two kids 13 and 16. We were able to check into our suite at 2pm. It was clean cool and huge. My wife slept in a king size bed with my daughter, my son wanted the pullout coach and I had a queen bed to myself. There were three flat screen TV's kitchen Microwave. The beds were cleaned each day by 2pm. We rented a Ford Mustang convertable(sounds nice,but for four people we should gotten a bigger car. No storage for luggage no leg room for rear passengers. The breakfasts were great and the dinners were even better. After spendind 350.00 at Seaworld we came back to a dinnner my finicky kids loved. Best was the free beer and wine. I had two beers and my wife had two glasses of wine. Free parking great location. Everyday I would run in the morning along the harbor. I have nothing but good things to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: roadtriper1
Reviews.Content: Had a Great stay at the Courtyard by Marriott San Deigo Liberty Station. We arrived early (11:30 am) and didn't think that we would be able to check in but, that wasn't a problem, our room was ready. The hotel is very nice, very clean and in an excellent location. Located on an esplanade it has very nice views for people fortunate to have a room on that side. If not, you can still enjoy the views pool side on when you walk along the esplanade. It is located across the river from the airport but, we didn't have any problems with noise. Close by you will find some good restaurants...like the Corvette Diner. It is also located a very short drive away to Sea World/Mission Beach, the San Diego Zoo, and Downtown San Diego. They do offer a great breakfast here with made to order omlettes as well a buffet with a great selection of things to choose from. The rooms are rather pricey but, worth the money. I would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: teddy_scot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights with teenage kids. Room Spotless, Breakfast was very good with omletted etc cooked to order. Free Parking. nearby subway and other restuarants. Nice Pool. Nice stting with promenade and park nearby On site starbucks coffee and deli. Staff were more than helpful especially Stephanie. Location requires a car. A bus serves the hotel to downtown but last return is 6.45pm. A bus serves airport until 11pm but it is a bit of a walk from there. Downtown, Old Town and most attractions are 10 mins by car. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, EXCELLENT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: jserna20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Courtyard Liberty Station for 1 night before moving on to seeing family in the area. Nothing but COMPLIMENTS for this place. Seems like area is fairly new, another hotel next to it, new retail, Starbucks and restaurants....newer housing around and area is right on the bay. Great views from room. Hotel is clean, staff is friendly, very helpful and knowledgeable of area. Pool is perfect for kids. A+++++ all around!! Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to satisfy!”
Reviews.Author: fritzie0461
Reviews.Content: When we visit our son in San Diego we always stay at the Marriott at Liberty Station. Actually I think we may be one of the first customers they had when they opened new a few years ago. We are never disappointed with our stay. The hotel is sparkling clean throughout and the staff is A+. Location is perfect for our needs and we have seen the area grow up around it. The shopping center only a few blocks away has great shops and a few restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else when visiting San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: SummerTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from the poolside at Courtyard Liberty Station, and we have been here for a week. We've been coming to San Diego from New Jersey for about ten years now, and have usually stayed at Hotel Circle's Marriott Residence Inn Seaworld/Mission Valley. We always liked the idea of having a suite with a full kitchen since our kids were younger and we'd often cook a few dinners throughout our stay. HOWEVER, our kids are 11 and 15 now and we will NEVER stay anywhere near Hotel Circle again. Here are the reasons... Courtyard Liberty Station: 1. is very clean and well taken care of, which the Residence Inn was not. 2. has a very nice pool area. 3. has balconies in some of the rooms that offer a beautiful view. We were overlooking the bay and North Island. 4. is walking distance to many good restaurants at Liberty Station. Our first night here, we walked right out front to Oggi's Pizza and had a very good, reasonably priced meal. They also have a Panera, Tender Greens, Vons Market, Subway, a Mexican Restaurant, sushi, etc. right out front. 5. has a nice workout room with 4 Lifefitness treadmills, 2 Lifefitness Elipticals, a recumbant bike, dumbbells, an exercise machine, water fountain, tv's, etc. 6. serves a great breakfast for around $12, including omelets, scrambled eggs, lox and bagels, etc. 7. has very nice employees who are extremely helpful. 5.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: joli28
Reviews.Content: Our family found this hotel to be a perfect match for our vacation. Incredible front counter service (thanks Stephanie), new hotel, wonderful room overlooking pool and harbor as requested, got in on a room rate (189) that included free breakfast for our family of four for three nights and $30 hotel credit each night for the last three nights to be used anywhere within the hotel, except alcohol. Perfectly located to all the sites were were hoping to see, free parking, great access to airport. We just new that we would be gone for most of the days and wouldn't justify spending upwards of 400/night at some other places. Spent alot of one day on Coronado Island and checked out the Del and Lowes....I wasn't impressed..they seemed old and outdated.. The renewal of Liberty Station area is quite a sight. Fun dining.... Our room was quiet and seemed to be oversized with a balcony....we spend a couple of nights down at the firepit just visiting with other families while our kids were swimming. We were there beginning on a Monday night for six nights....The weekend was definitely busier....Would go back and stay again with no hesitation. Had perfect weather which is pretty much the norm in San Diego...Don't miss taking your family kayaking in La Jolla....one of our highlights...

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best mid-priced hotel you could want in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and if you have read many of my previous reviews on this site you would know that I am devoted to the Marriott brand. Quite simply, they are the best bang for the buck. When you stay at a Marriott you aren't sleeping at some dive nor at a world-class hotel. This was my first trip to San Diego. Came out here for Comic-Con. Ultimately I booked the Residence Inn downtown for the duration of Comic-Con but decided to add an extra day of R&R and booked the Courtyard Marriott located 4 minutes from the San Diego airport. The experience here has been mostly great. As every review prior to mine indicates this is a new hotel and it's quite nice. It certainly lives up to or exceeds any Marriott I have stayed at. Upon arrival I was booked in a really nice room on the second floor complete with balcony overlooking the pool. That was a real treat within itself. I didn't ask for such a special room but they gave me a choice of several at the front desk. The room itself is wonderful. It had a couch and a great workstation to plug my laptop into. The hotel is situated in a very nice waterfront area complete with walking track. I wish I had more time to walk the area as it seems very beautiful. Instead, I chose to go down to the pool and spend an hour or two there. The pool is tiny. By the time I got there kids were already swimming in it and I decided I probably would not enjoy a swim. So, I laid in the sun for a bit but shortly thereafter more kids arrived and I decided to leave. Too many kids yelling, screaming and diving in the pool just isn't my idea of relaxation. Then again, this is the kind of hotel that is going to attract families so who am I to complain. Have kids? They will enjoy the company of other kids. Want to relax? Too many kids. Was going to hang out in the bar, but it didn't seem like a happening place. Some of the Marriotts have a happy hour with food and drink specials but this bar didn't seem to have any of that going on. Bed was very comfortable. Absolutely no plane noise. I found out the planes stop flying by 10pm so no need to worry about losing sleep. In fact, the most noise I incurred was the slamming of doors throughout the night. The walls are thin here -- I could hear voices -- but I managed to sleep well nonetheless. Room has a high definition LCD television and all sorts of ports to plug in your video camera or PC. Free wired and wireless high speed Internet is always a welcome bonus. There is even a Keurig coffee maker in the room with a selection of coffees and teas --- buy wouldn't you know it, my coffee maker was broken. I hear these Keurig coffee makers, as nice as they are, don't stand up to repeated use. In the morning, since I did not have a working coffee maker, I went to the lobby where they have a Waterside Deli that served very good coffee, but its pastries were abysmal. I skipped the buffet breakfast. Parking is free which is another huge, huge bonus. The only major negative surprise here is the elevator. It's a single elevator (though there seems to be two at separate locations) but to get to it you have to go through a tiny, standard doorway. Some poor guy walked into the hotel with a skid of luggage. In trying to get through the doorway to the elevator he had to take all his luggage off the skid. It was ridiculous. I have never seen such a small accessway to an elevator inside a hotel. With one elevator at your disposal it can be slow wait at times. In all, I would make this my first choice of stay the next time I come to San Diego. It's almost a hidden secret how great a hotel this is. I hope it stays that way because it's very rare that you can get such a nice hotel like this with free parking and Internet for this price point.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: shamers2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading good reviews here and noting which areas of SD we were planning to visit. Wasn't interested in Gaslight with the kids, didn't want to pay for parking or an old room at Mission Bay, and wanted to be fairly central to the historic sites. The location was central to downtown SD/harbor, Old Town, and Point Loma/Cabrillo. There was plenty to do, see, and eat near the hotel (Point Loma Seafood!), and most everything we wanted to visit was a quick jaunt in the car. It's a pretty recently redeveloped area and was completely safe and nice. We had a king room with a pullout bed for our 4-year-old and a pack-and-play for the baby, and it was tight but we fit. The room was not as spacious as some courtyards we've been in, but I would stay there again. The rooms are even smaller in the older hotels. It's still a new hotel and was very clean and pleasant. I used the guest laundry and the machine I chose happened to break on us and the front desk staff took a few minutes to figure out how to handle the problem, but my money was refunded and they gave us extra soap to run another load. The hotel is very near the airport which was initially a concern because my husband is a super light sleeper, but he slept through whatever flights there were (with the windows/balcony door closed), as did both kids. Airport noise was not a problem at all. As with most other Courtyards we've stayed at, the breakfast is a complete ripoff. We got the free breakfast rate and paid $10 extra per night to feed us and the kids, which is the only way to eat breakfast there. It's basically your free continental breakfast at any other hotel, plus some dude in a chef hat flipping you an omelet. That omelet was NOT worth $12 or whatever the menu lists it for. If you're going to pay $12, go to a real breakfast joint. Overall it's a very nice hotel in a nice area and we would definitely stay at Liberty Point again. It's a great hotel/area for families.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: retired67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because it was rated the #2 hotel in San Diego on your web site. What are all these other people "smoking?" What a joke and a cruel one at that. This was a weekend get away for my husband and I. Very disappointing! The front desk staff acted like we were an inconvenience for them. We arrived at 3:00 PM and I said that we would wait to get a room with a nice view. A couple of weeks prior to our stay, I had talked with front desk staff and requested a room with a view of Liberty Park and/or bay. I am also a Marriott Reward Program member and have been for 30 years. On my rewards data, I have a permanent request for a high floor. Granted this hotel only has four floors. Well, it took us three rooms to get one with an acceptable view. First we were sent to a room on the second floor looking at a concrete roof and concrete wall of the next building. The next room, also second floor, all you saw when you looked out from the room was the high wall of the patio. The room was among their smallest, and it felt like you were in a dungeon. If you went out on the patio and looked over the top of the wall, you would see water. If you looked down, you saw roof. The third room was OK. We had to wait 30 minutes for it to be ready. Which was fine, and what we had said repeatedly when we first checked in. Third floor room, looked out over the roof of the portico at front of hotel, but did have a little view of distant hillside of Point Loma. We were tired by this time. Oh, the keys didn't work, so we had to go back to the front desk, again. We almost checked out on Saturday, but then decided to stay. I didn't sleep much at all the first night. The air conditioner sounded like a freight train was coming through the room, so every time it turned all, I would wake up. You would think that there would be better sound proofing in the newer hotels. People talking next door, doors banging, woke me at 1:00 AM. My husband said he thought someone was running the olympics above us. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The room decor is also very nice. Probably will NOT go back.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA_tao
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very new. Rooms are spacious and parking is free. Hotel is located in a shopping center with plenty of eating options (if you're looking for a quick bite) and with a nice view of the city. I enjoyed my stay and was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. After staying in several other hotels (Hard Rock, Marriott, and Hyatt) in the gaslamp, Seaworld area and old town, I would choose this hotel again over all the others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: debedmtzIllinois
Reviews.Content: Two minutes from the airport, built 2 years ago, and very friendly staff that gave advice on what to do and maps on how to get there. Right on water way with a nice jogging track along side of it. Centrally located to Old Town, The Hill, Coronado Island and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: tooka
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, when I saw that this was the 2nd ranking hotel in San Diego I was a bit skeptical. I recall telling my husband to maybe book a fancier hotel in a location not next to the airport. I'm so happy he didn't listen to me!! When you are traveling with a toddler, and when the plan is to stay for a few days only, it is actually good to be close to the airport. I usually have a list of pros & cons for the hotels I review. Or usually write that the hotel was almost perfect but... NOT THIS TIME!! Let me tell you nothing about this hotel was bad. Yes its close to the airport and sometimes you hear the planes, but it is not a problem at all. The hotel is not super fancy, but when you have a toddler a fancy hotel may not be the best thing, This hotel is new, clean and in a great location. Close to the zoo, Seaworld, Old Town, La Jolla, Mission Bay & the airport. The rooms are clean, nice and a good size. The pool area is very nice. The restaurant is great with a good breakfast buffet. The staff are nice and courteous. Both check in & out took 3 minutes!! The hotel is also right next to a plaza filled with restaurants & Starbucks. The restaurants might not be great, but it'll do for the first day you arrive. The hotel is also a 10min walk to another plaza with Vons, Trader Joes, and yes Starbucks! I actually have nothing negative to say!! Trust me this is a first. My tip to travelers is STAY AT THIS HOTEL. You will be surprised. Two other things that make this hotel a great deal: 1-FREE PARKING (some hotels were asking for $25/day) and room service until 10pm (we have stayed at expensive hotels with room service only between 5-8pm)

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected; staff adds charm.”
Reviews.Author: parlayjay
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to California. I'm used to staying at bigger chains but this Courtyard's location, price and its reviews kindled my interest. I was definitely happy with the location. It's close to civilization but kind of tucked away next to the mouth of San Diego Bay. We checked in after 4pm but they didn't have the kind of room I requested. I chose to hold out and wait for something closer to my liking. The agent helping me for my entire stay was Joe. He definitely did a good job and hopefully somebody from this Courtyard will recognize him for his efforts. (He checked us in, was there when we went out for dinner and checked us out the next morning!) Our waiting for a room was actually a good thing as we were able to see the nearby attractions like the USS Recruit. We also walked up and down the area looking over the bridge (Halsey Rd) and had our 5-year-old play at the Park at Beacon Point. When we did finally get into a room it fit our requests. The room was cozy and clean. Although I would recommend staying in a King suite as it has more room and a better view. Our view was slightly obstructed by palm trees but all-in-all it wasn't bad. The area around the hotel is clean and there are plenty of restaurants in the area too if you don't feel like eating hotel food. It's close to the San Diego Zoo/Seaport Village/Point Loma. We will be back to San Diego before the year is up and we fully expect to stay here. Avoid the higher priced hotels and traffic... give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: canyonbound
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the lobby we knew this was going to be a great stay. The staff at the front desk was very friendly, efficient, and made the effort to give us a room that met all of our requests. The room itself was modern, large, and extremely comfortable. The food in the dining room was high quality, fresh, and delicious. The full breakfast buffet in the morning is an excellent value at just $13, or $11 for the continental breakfast (which was much more than just a stale muffin and juice like most other hotels). The location is excellent, just off off Harbor Drive, which takes you to anywhere you could want to go in the city. Yes, it is near the airport, so do expect some airplane noise (our room faced the airport but the slight rumble of planes taking off was not bad at all, and we couldn't hear it at all after we went to bed). I would absolutely stay in this hotel again on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for families with children”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamily04
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 1/2 year old son, and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. The hotel was very clean and well located. We had a room with a balcony that overlooked the pool, so the view was very nice from there. I had added a comment online when I booked that we would prefer a room with a balcony, and we did receive that type of room. Liberty Station was a beautiful, clean, and safe feeling area. There is a trail behind the hotel that you can walk down to go to a great park with a playground. This was one of the nicest playgrounds that we have been to. There are plenty of restaurants and grocery stores nearby, so we did a lot of our dining out near the hotel. The room had a refrigerator, but no microwave. This hotel is really near the airport, so if you are outside you will hear and see planes taking off and landing. The view of the airplanes taking off was a plus for us because our son loved seeing them. The noise inside was not enough to disturb us. I dropped the sleep quality down 1 mark from excellent only because one night there were people talking too loud and too late on the patio below our room which made it a little difficult to sleep. All of the attractions we wanted to go to in San Diego were just a short drive away from this hotel without having to fight downtown traffic. We did enjoy the fact that there was a nice laundry facility and free internet in the business center at this hotel. The only thing that could make this hotel better would be a free breakfast buffet, but I have not seen one of those in a Courtyard. We will be staying at this hotel if we return to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best overall places I have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Clean, crisp, new rooms with a frig and microwave. Friendly staff and decent breakfast buffet. Pool is a good size and not too crowded. This place is the best if you have young kids. A HUGE and beautiful park right near the hotel, with great water views and you can see the airplanes take off! Also with 2 great kid parks for them to slide on. Walking distance is a great shopping/food complex so you dont have to waste your time looking for meals. Los Primos mexican food is just awesome, as is the Thai and sushi places. This hotel is so close to Sea World and downtown (4 miles each) - that it doesnt make sense to stay and pay overpriced hotel rates to be downtown. This is just one of the most convenient, clean, best located and kid friendly hotels I have ever seen. And free Wi-Fi!!!!!!!!!! Cons - thin walls, can hear your neighbors, sadly this is true of all new construction hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tgrbait
Reviews.Content: Hotel opened in 2008; is well maintained. The staff is very helpful. Great location central to most attractions; BEAUTIFUL VIEW!

Reviews.Title: “NICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cybermama
Reviews.Content: This is a gem! My college age son and I got a room with a meal credit and that was about right for a nice room and two very good breakfast buffets. The pool and hot tub are great, the restaurant was pretty good for a hotel, and the grounds were magnificent. Our room had one of those Keurig coffee makers in it and it was neat to try one out. The Liberty Station area is cool. It's across from the airport; so, you get a bit of air traffic noise. We were able to block that out.
