I was able to take a nice long walk the evening before my son's flight arrived and found a Trader Joe's and a Vons market. There are some delightful restaurants in the area, too. I highly recommend De Kine and the Corvette Diner. It's easy getting around the Liberty Station area and this is a great place to stay when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: Oceanview Please
Reviews.Content: If you travel Iâ€™m sure you have been fooled and disappointed by the pictures and descriptions on hotel websites, I know I have, and feel the needles when those in the group tell you, â€œYou know I thought this was going to beâ€¦â€¦.â€� We go to SeaWorld at least two times a year and have stayed at a few hotels and I must say if this place had a larger pool I would say it was as good if not better than the Hilton resort on Mission bay for $150.00 a night less. My only complaints were the size of the pool, (a little small, but very nice and there is a Jacuzzi) and no breakfast room service. Room service for dinner was very good and reasonable. I cannot say enough about the staff, professional, courteous and fast, make a request and itâ€™s done. I was impressed from the barista at the hotels Starbucks, front desk, even housekeepingâ€¦ The Liberty Station area is worth a little exploring. Itâ€™s on the property of the old basic training facility of the US Navy in San Diego and reeks with history. San Diego has done well to preserve the integrity of the area and honoring those who have served this country. I hope Monterey and San Francisco do as well with their inherited Military Installations... I found going to their web site and using AAA got me better rates than any of the online booking sites by about $30.00, so it helps to shop. I asked to stay on the ground floor but when I go again, and we will, Iâ€™ll ask for upper floor room with a balcony facing SeaWorld on the chance you can see the nightly fireworks. The area has plenty of shops and eateries, and this place seems central to everything Mission bay a miles or so north, San Diego harbor a mile or so south, if your new to the area donâ€™t miss either one. Hope this helpsâ€¦ Good Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: WalnutBaron
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through marriott.com after seeing the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. The reviews were spot on. This hotel is exceptionally well-managed, very clean, and resides in a wonderful location less than three miles from the airport. Built in a new planned community called Liberty Station, it's surrounded by restaurants and shops, is flanked by a lovely inland waterway, and is very quiet except for the occasional jet flying over. The earlier reviewer said she thought the place was expensive, but she must have bought last minute. I reserved a room here less than three weeks before my stay at a AAA rate of $119/night. I consider this an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: busyasabeeMichigan
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. It was a little difficult to find after a long night of flying but its a beautiful well managed property. The rooms were wonderful and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is very pricey I actually paid more for a night at this hotel than a night at the JW Marriott in Palm Springs. The breakfast at the hotel was average, the food was very greasy and I had a hard time finishing my meal, my toast was burnt as well. All things considered the hotel was very nice, the front desk was extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JKG2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 2 years old and is absolutely gorgeous. Has all amenities such as on-site restaurant, small deli, bar, pool, several lounge areas outside, walking trails, nearby restaurants within easy walking, awesome playground, attractive grounds, excellent staff service.

Reviews.Title: “All around, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Arkamus
Reviews.Content: I looked at the ranking of this hotel and wondered if it could be true? After checking in, I realized why. It's not your typical courtyard. It has amenties like a restaurant and bar. Free WiFi. You can walk to some restaurants nearby and Trader Joes is in the neighborhood if you have a car. Overall, the location is perfect. Everything seemed so close to the hotel. The hotel/rooms are very new and spacious. My only complaint was the mattress; too soft. And we didnt get a room with a view of the esplanade behind the hotel. If we had, that would have made our day. The esplanade is beautiful. The staff are polite and helped us get a rental car. The old town trolley bus tour picks you up from the hotel next door. If I go back to SD, I will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: patricia47
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is modern, clean, and welcoming. The staff is amazing - the cook to order omlettes are wonderful - that fresh fruit - ummmm. My room had two queen beds, a gigantic 42 inch flat screen TV, a roomy desk, free internet, free parking, free work out room, and a competitive room rate - with a shuttle to the airport..... Liberty Square is the Naval Training Center turned into a wonderful beautiful experience. . Check it out on the web . This was my second time at this hotel - I'll never stay anywhere else in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “See Photo's of the needles, Insulin... could be?? could be something else”
Reviews.Author: Perrini
Reviews.Content: Simply Terrible to stick your hand behind a picture sitting on a ledge in the hotel and find 2 HYPODERMIC NEEDLES. Then after taking pictures i called and spoke with Joe the Manager, he wrote it off because he said probably insulin units.... My reply was are you kidding, what do junkies use and reuse!! They are very lucky that i had no young kids and the units had caps on the needle part. Joe made it up to our room and picked them up...NO GLOVES, weird? he than stated that the GM would be in on Sunday and they would call to discuss what could be done or simply an apology. NO ONE EVER CALLED!! When we went to check out Monday I asked for the General Manager and they said he would be up in 5 minutes, when he showed up he did not introduce himself nor offered any apology, he just stood there like I was some crazy person..... I was very cool but do need to let folks know that this hotel simply had an attitude of not caring and pointing fingers do not work with me when it comes to health and safety. As a General Manager he should have been rolling out the red carpet, they did give us some breakfast coupons of which on Monday we could not use because the kitchen closes at 10am and we got there at 9:58... The waffle bar was already cleaned up..... I guess if I did not have to wait for the GM we would have made breakfast.... O well, not going to change my lifestyle but could change yours.... It is not the fact that I found the needles, itâ€™s was the poor and very unprofessional manner of handling it and being so lackadaisical about the safety of my family.... Very Disappointing, Very Unprofessional and a terrible way to handle a business especially a home away from home...... Jeff Perrin

Reviews.Title: “Great location, incredible views, reasonable price considering the location.”
Reviews.Author: GOVtravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: What else can I say. If you go, insist on an upper level floor with a poolside balcony. The views to the city are incredible at night. Yes, the airport is right next door and I suppose if you are a light sleeper you could have some issues. But with the sliding balcony door closed, I had no problem at all. Relatively new hotel with restaurant and bar, a little more expensive but nice. You have to try Oggi's Pizza which is on the backside of the parking lot. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View - Serene Location”
Reviews.Author: DJBrighton
Reviews.Content: What a great location -- serene beauty, views of the water and Harbor Island -- from almost every room. This hotel is very "Southern Cal"; smartly decorated in contemporary colors, very clean, professional staff, etc. The Pros: reasonably priced rooms; harbor views; waterfront paths for walking and jogging; nice pool and hot tub. The Cons: Large windows, but they only open about four inches (unless you get a balcony room); the most uncomfortably firm beds I've experienced in a Marriott brand -- they're probably good for your back though. Cautionary warning, this hotel is located in a beautiful setting, but one that is directly in the flight path of the airport. If you like your windows open at night, and really hate the sound of jet aircrafts, this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, helpful and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: HelmutHungary
Reviews.Content: We felt ourselves very well in this hotel. Large, clean rooms, helpful staff, delicious breakfast, huge parking lot. If you have a car, this is really the place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel â€“ Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yakster14
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from San Diego in March. We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Liberty Station and were highly impressed with the hotel. The hotel is centrally located to all of the attractions where you can get to Sea World, the zoo, downtown, etc in 15 minutes or less. We did have a rental car which made it very convenient to get around. The hotel does NOT charge for parking which is a huge plus because many hotels do in the area. Check-in was easy and they allowed us to check in early around 1pm. Itâ€™s a 5 minute drive from the airport so it was nice to get right to the hotel and unload after a long flight. The rooms were very nice and clean. We had two queen beds and a single sleeper which was perfect for our two boys (ages 3 and 5). Just allowed them to have their own beds at night. The bathroom was large, the TV was big and offered plenty of channels to watch. The room had a mini-fridge which was perfect to store milk, water, pop, etc. The room also had a Keurig coffee maker which was a very nice touch. Very convenient to make a cup of coffee and they offered plenty of coffee flavors. Our room did not have a balcony, but there are rooms that have them. I think because we got the room with the sleeper sofa meant there was not a balcony but we preferred the sleeper sofa option. Yes the hotel is near the airport but when you are in your room you donâ€™t really notice it. They built it in such a way that it blocks out the noise very well where it didnâ€™t bother us at all. Most of the flights are done by 10pm anyway. The kids loved the poolâ€¦was heated and also had a hot tub area as well. Lots of outdoor patio space with a fire-pit but we never used much of that. The hotel is very conveniently location near restaurants, Starbucks, grocery store, etc. There is a walking path right outside the doors that leads to a great playground for the kids. The hotel had a restaurant, cafÃ©, and bar as well. We never ate at the restaurant but it sure smelled good. The hotel does not offer a free breakfast so we just got items at the local grocery store and used our fridge in our room to cover the first meal of the day. There is a great pizza place nearby (Oggiâ€™s) and Subway as well but most of the time we were out and about around San Diego. Though the hotel was a Courtyard it felt more like a big hotel with all the amenities it offered. We were very pleased with our entire stay. We really felt this was one of the best hotels we have stayed at for the money. I hope they keep up what they are currently doing with this property because I will surely stay here again in the future. I also heard the property next door (Homewood Suites) is owned by the same owner so we would also look to stay there as well. Both properties get excellent reviews so the owner and staff are doing a great job. San Diego is an awesome city to visit and this property and location makes a great home base for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great business traveller hotel. You can book this location with confidence!”
Reviews.Author: Gablestout
Reviews.Content: Only 3 miles from San Diego International, and located at Liberty Station, this hotel is often booked, so plan ahead. If your booking on the gov/military rate, the hotel usually books out about 3-weeks in advance. It's not in the downtown core, but close (4 miles), located across the street from the Point Loma FASWTC Naval base. Quiet location, standard (by which I mean good) Courtyard hot breakfast buffet, dinner (did not eat diner there), good open-layout bar with three TVs (and doesn't have that creepy business-traveller-bar feel), espresso cafe (brews Starbucks, but isn't an actual Starbucks) with cafe food (panini etc...), pool, hottub, private courtyard, plenty of free parking, free wireless, room service (5pm-10pm only), dry-cleaning, coin-op laundry with free soap (ask at the desk), modern rooms with LCDs and iPod/iPhone docks on the alarm clocks. They also have the network/video/audio connection strip that allows you to connect your laptop to the TV to review presentations or watch DVDs. Liberty Station also has a Starbucks located in it, and an Oggi's (microbrews, good food, great pizzas) that are a 1-minute walk form the hotel (I usually eat at Oggi's). This hotel has an excellent combination of ammenities that any serious business traveller looking for a relaxing base-camp would want. This location is everything that the "Courtyard" concept was designed for. I've stayed there three times, and it is now the first San Diego lodging I check for when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Close to Airport Choice”
Reviews.Author: travelmarcia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in most of the San Diego airport hotels and this is the one I'll return to. It was pouring rain when I arrived so having many in-hotel choices for food was great - room service, restaurant, deli and 24 hour convenience store) I opted for room service and the food was very good - crab cakes and sweet potato fries - yum! The location right on a canal with pathways, many many shops and restaurants within blocks was perfect. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable, my room spacious, very clean and modern. The mini fridge also came in handy. It was a little chilly for me to try the pool or hot tub but the outside location with comfy chairs, couches, out door fireplace, looked like a wonderful place to relax. Lots of other amenities including ice cold flavored water (try the watermelon!) right by the front desk to refresh you when you return from a jog. To save a little $$ I took the free shuttle to the hotel when I landed (be sure to have the phone number handy as you need to call them for pick up) and back to pick up a rental car the next day. I repeated that process the day before I went home - no need to return the rental car the morning of flight - much less stressful and saved 2 days of rental costs. And this hotel even provides FREE parking!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel-perfect for airport traveler and business!”
Reviews.Author: noplainjayne
Reviews.Content: What a great ending to our vacation! We stayed here for just one night before our flight out of San Diego airport. The location was ideal for us. The hotel, while not luxurious, more than met our needs and we are happy to recommend it. The hotel itself has contemporary styling. Not to my tastes, but it was clean, comfortable and very functional. The bathroom was great. It looked like they put a lot of thought into the needs of the business traveler, with easy computer hookups and a comfortable work chair. The flat screen tv was great, with HD channels---something our much higher priced hotel had lacked. Don't expect fancy sheets or towels, but do expect a comfortable sleep. We were pleasantly surprised that the airport noise didn't affect us at all. Free parking, too. The hotel is in the Liberty Station area. It is next to Homewood Suites, but is newer. We didn't need a suite and didn't need or desire to cook our own meals, so Courtyard was just fine with us. There are plenty of chain type restaurants within walking distance, but the hotel restaurant was an absolute gem! We ate dinner there, but had an excellent meal. After eating overpriced, ridiculous meals for a few days, the meal in the Courtyard was a welcome surprise! The wine list, although not extravagant, was well thought, and reasonably priced. The bar was also a welcome relief. The staff was excellent, friendly, but not over the top. Well done, Courtyard! If you have extra time, you might consider driving to the Cabrillo monument. It's an easy 15 minute drive through a mostly residential area. They have limited hours (9-5?), but it's well worth even a short visit to Rosecrans cemetery and the monument. The views are spectacular. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: biggroofy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to Homewood Suites Airport/Liberty Station - so they shared the same benefits of location, convenience. The shuttle driver told me that the owner owns both hotels, therefore they shared the shuttle service. This is a BETTER hotel than Homewood Suites next door. It is very clean, rooms are spacious (note they don't have suites), and they are much newer. We arrived late and the complimentary shuttles picks us up at Terminal 2 within 10 minutes since I called. Check in was a breeze. The carpet in our rooms are new and bathroom is spotless. Staff are also very friendly and helpful. Any dark side? Hum, a little bit - since it is right next door to Homewood you would expect the airplane noise. It is slight better though (maybe better insulation?). Homewood offers free breakfast, but the restaurant in Courtyard offers the same continental breakfast buffet for $10 USD. We ordered American breakfast for $12, that comes with a toast, 2 bacons, and 2 eggs. I'd suggest saving the money and go outside for breakfast. Anyways, this is a very good hotel (compared to Homewood which we stayed prior to our departure)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: One of the best Courtyards I've stayed at - clean, quiet, comfortable, modern. Room was spacious with newer ameneties (i.e. high def TV, wireless, in-room espresso). Staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent work out room (4 treads, lots of equipment). Location is convenient to everything, and there are even some restaurants within walking distance. Only thing I would improve is free airport shuttle, in-room check-out (I had to go to the front desk) and a paper at the room door. Other than that, it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and value”
Reviews.Author: PatrickKalispell_MT
Reviews.Content: Before our cruise to Mexico we stayed here and really liked the hotel, grounds, restuarants and closeness of the airport. We spent two nites here. The first nite we thought it best to be on the parking lot side of the hotel in room 328; bad idea, the hotel airconditioner//compressor was right outside out window and very noisy. The next day we asked to be transferred to the poolside of the hotel that is also closer to the airport. It was heavenly as we left the patio door open all nite and had a nice cool breeze off San Diego bay. Surprisingly we couldn't hear the airport in the morning before 8 AM and would recommend this side of the building for the view and quietness. We ate one nite at the restuarant and found it to be very good and above 'hotel food' we were expecting. There are great restuarants in the area within walking distance, ie Starbucks, Pizza, Suchi and even a Trader Joes about 5 blocks away. The hotel had free internet and free parking which was a plus along with the price of the room, about $150 per nite for two queen size beds. The hotel is in almost new condition and very comfortable. We would return on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is o.k, but not superb”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller70
Reviews.Content: Paid approx. Â£100 a night, but can't help but think this is overpriced for what you get. Rooms are nice enough - ask for one with a view of the pool/city. Staff at front desk are polite, but seem to lack the personal touch. Petty point, but towels are awful - clean and plentiful, but felt like rags and smelt of bleach. Guest laundry facilities for only a few dollars and they provide free washing powder and fabric conditioner. You need to drive if you are staying here (free parking) and downtown is probably a 10 minute drive, with the wharf a bit closer. There are a few decent places to eat only about 2-3 minutes away, including Thai, Pizza, Greek, Sushi cusine as well as a Starbucks. So, whilst the hotel is o.k, it could probably be better or reduce its rates to bring them more in line with the standard you get.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: talimoth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 11/3 - 11/5. This was our second visit here. Check-in was quick and we were given a room that was over looking the bay. This hotel is near the airport and freeway and is a short drive to many beaches and parks. There are ample places to eat around the hotel and a Starbucks within walking distance. We did not use room service but did have hamburgers in the restaurant the last evening and they were good. This is by far our favorite hotel in San Diego. The location is great and the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay by the airport”
Reviews.Author: jzak11
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this Courtyard. It was pretty much what I expected. Basic room: bed, TV, work area, chair, coffee maker. There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel, but I used neither so can not comment on the food or service. The staff was friendly and helpful. There are restaurants and shopping within walking distance, as well as a trail along the lagoon. You are not too far from Old Town San Diego (quick drive) which is a neat place to see. There is a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. This is a great place to stay if you have an early morning flight because it takes less than five minutes to get to the terminal. Hint: If you have a rental car and want to save time in the morning, you can return the rental car the night before departing, take their shuttle to the airport, then call the hotel to pick you up. This saves a lot of time and allows you those precious extra few moments of sleep. The parking is free, which is a big advantage over some other hotels in the area. Overall, this is a no-frills hotel at a decent price and a good location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Courtyard in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Puddy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights while sightseeing in San Diego. Location was just off Harbor Dr, very convenient to everything. Hotel new and modern, bed very comfortable. Ate breakfast and dinner in restaurant. Food and service very good. Also had deli with sandwiches, ice cream, and breakfast foods. Staff very efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stop”
Reviews.Author: jhasko
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the San Diego Courtyard Marriott as a stopover from Hawaii to NY. It was the perfect choice. There is a van service to and from the airport which is efficient and friendly. The hotel is spotless and the rooms updated, roomy and clean. The restaurant had closed prior to our arrival, 10PM is a weekday shutdown time in San Diego, but the front desk provided us with an Italian restaurnat that delivered. You have two choices for breakfast a simple Starbucks or a full meal at the 2592 restaurant. The bed was very comfortable, and the room had many energy saving features includng the shower. There is a walking, jogging path along the intercoastal in the back of the hotel which is a delight. We will be back! The staff is exceptional and assisted us "beyond the call of duty to help us make our plane.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a real find! Thank you TripAdvisor for helping us find it.”
Reviews.Author: smokeyj
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the cheapest at $135 a night but oh what a deal. The area is new, level; safe, lots of park and walking paths. The location was central to all the tourist stuff and we navigated the city easily from here. There is free wireless internet, parking and even laundry detergent. The front dest staff were unfailingly helpful polite and went the extra bit a few times (phoned the hotel next door to see if they had a copy of the LA Times, accommodated our request for a balcony room, and let us stay an extra night on short notice without having to change rooms).. The room was spacious, modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: greasyregs
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard met my needs as a business traveler. The room had many nice features; I especially like the room amenities for getting my work done. Good wireless internet service (free), great desk space and comfortable chair - just what I need for my travels. The hotel pool and jacuzzi pool were comfortable and well taken care of. The lounge/bar area was comfortable with a bartender who was very personable and gracious. Also a very interesting location adjacent to the former Naval Training Center that has been turned over to private enterprise. Lots of areas to take long walks and enjoy the marina/harbor area. Really liked having both a Trader Joe's and Vons, and Cold Stone Creamery within walking distance. Only complaint was that the parking lot got a bit noisy on a couple of nights. I prefer to sleep with an open window and it seemed that management could have asked groups of partying people in the parking lot to keep the noise down after 10pm but they didn't.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: stolkien
Reviews.Content: Good location, modern, clean, friendly hotel. Stayed for 2 days with my husband and 2 daughters aged 7&11. Room clean and tidy, near to lift though heard no noise from it. Girls loved the nearby ice machine!Room a good size had a rollaway small sofa already in room with bed linen in wardrobe. Good free internet service and some free printing available.Restaurant only had breakfast. We all had the buffet each day, plenty available,good selection fresh eggs and waffles cooked.Good helpful waiter staff. Good location to San Diego, shopping, gas lamp area and sea front, 10 minute drive to Sea World.20 minutes to Fashion Valley Mall great place fof all ends of shopping.Bloomingdales to Old Navy.Free hotel parking a bonus Only slight down point, is minor noise from nearby airport from 7 am but Im a slight sleeper and it wasn't too much of a problem.I would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful rooms/grounds”
Reviews.Author: travmama
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here after staying intially at the Homewood Suites next door and touring around southern CA. We stayed here for our last night in CA before flying home the next day. We returned our car to the nearby airport and took the hotel shuttle back to the hotel. This was the nicest Courtyard I have stayed at. However, I did like the Homewood Suites next door better (owned by the same person we were told) because of the full kitchen and extra amenities. Free and adequate parking. Room were clean, large and beautiful. Snack area/deli closed too early for our use. Shuttle to the airport the next day was clean and reliable. Location is perfect - see my review on the Homewood Suites for more location information. Very nice hotel - I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, in a beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: maxfly
Reviews.Content: First things first. One thing I always want to know is the area, and this hotel is indeed in a safe upscale neighborhood. This hotel looks brand new, and rooms are modern with refrig and microwave. Hotel is a mile south of airport, but we couldn't hear any noise as its not directly in the flightpath. Hotel is close to downtown, zoo, and Sea World. Restaurants , Starbucks, TCBY and Subway in attached parking lot. Hotel has a bar and restaurant, which we did not eat at, but it looked nice.Stayed here 2 days and were very happy with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rtlong_iv
Reviews.Content: We watched the 4th of July fireworks from our hotel room and enjoyed wonderful weather for out San Diego stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlphaRiss
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We were vacationing in Southern Cal and decided to move here the night before our early morning flight. Were we glad that we did! This was such a nice hotel. As my husband, who travels alot said, this wasn't your typical Marriott Courtyard. It was such a beautiful, well-maintained hotel. It had a resort-type feel to it. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the beds were very comfortable. The location was awesome - right on the waterfront and literally 1-2 miles from the airport. It was an easy drive to downtown San Diego also. The hotel was extremely well-maintained and very clean. The only complaint that I have is that we only spent 1 night here. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Tennis95
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights with my husband and 14 yr old daughter. We loved the hotel. We decided on this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. We arrived 3 hrs early and our room was ready which after a long flight was a relief. The location was great, beautiful park outside hotel with water views, nice place to run or walk. Pool very nice. We ate breakfast at the Waterside cafe outside which had house coffee complimentary. We had a rental car. The hotel is central to all the sites. Free parking and free internet service. We loved San Diego. So much to do and see. We did the Seal Tour which was fantastic. LaJolla is a must see. Looking forward to returning and would stay at the Courtyard again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: clnscheffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Courtyard Liberty Station for our family vacation to San Diego. It was awesome! We had a room with a balcony that overlooked the bay and had a view of downtown. The staff was awesome and we got to check in early! The pool area was really nice with a hot tub and firepit area. Lots of seating. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast and the buffet was really good. The area around the hotel was awesome! Lots of places to eat, shop and walk/run. Would definately recommend to anyone and would stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a beautiful area and contemporary rooms”
Reviews.Author: ploeg8393
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and has a stunning courtyard area. I was given a balcony room, which didn't have patio chairs, and liked it alot. I had a flat screen tv with satellite. The staff was super helpful and the bar area was also quite nice. I did not eat at the restaurant on site. The rooms were very up to date and had nice appliances. The bathrooms were clean and visually nice also. Great for business trips, weekend getaways, and short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriott Liberty Station was an outstanding place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: beachbunny74
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at this Courtyard by Marriott for seven nights from June 12-19. My husband was attending a conference at another hotel, but when I researched nearby hotels, this one stood out above all the rest! It was new, sparkling clean, and extremely well-maintained! Our room was on the fourth floor with a beautiful view of the pool and the bay. Everyone on staff from the front desk to the cleaning staff were friendly, helpful, and very efficient. The front desk staff was probably the most helpful that I have ever encountered during my travels. (Our family has traveled extensively and frequently.) When asked for suggestions on eating and entertainment, they were always right on target. They checked restaurants for us, offered us pool towels to take to the beach, and went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. We took every suggestion that they offered, and we were never disappointed! We have traveled to San Diego and the La Jolla area several times, and enjoyed this hotel much more than others that we have stayed in. I would highly recommend it! We will definitely be back! (I normally do not write such lengthy reviews, but this hotel definitely warranted such a review.)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel if a little out of town”
Reviews.Author: Kerrymonkey
Reviews.Content: This was a superb hotel in terms of service , decor etc. Couldn't fault it. It's just a little bit out of town. The cab ride to say the gaslamp was roughly $17 each time. This adds up when you make several trips. Having said that if you have a car you're just around the corner from SeaWorld and that's a plus. Overall I really liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, good location - but awful pillows!”
Reviews.Author: exncgal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here in late May/early June; it was one of the official Rock & Roll Marathon hotels and was close to the finish line. The hotel is new (maybe 1-2 years old) and everything was fresh and clean. Our room was very well laid-out and housekeeping was thorough, although they did tend to come mid-afternoons rather than mornings. We also had a mini-fridge in the room (perfect for snacks and drinks) - apparently this is standard - and free wireless internet. The WiFi is set up to allow you to send documents to the business center for printing, and they have a dedicated PC just for printing boarding passes. Location was really good - it is at one end of a retail/residential complex that is still in development, so we were just a short drive/long walk from several restaurants, a grocery store, and coffee shops. (More shops are being opened - drive around to see what's there.) The hotel is also just 5 minutes from the airport and provides easy access to most of the western side of San Diego; we also drove 15 min to the Old Town trolley station to head downtown one night. The staff was helpful with driving directions and suggestions for local sightseeing. My only "complaints" were that while the mattress was fantastic, the pillows were awful (overly squishy). Oh well, guess you can't have everything! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carjokn
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip as a surprise anniversary gift, and was not disappointed. We thought the hotel was a little hard to find on our own, though I do believe they offer free airport shuttles (we had a rental car). A good tip for us would have been if someone said to look for the Naval academy entrance off of Harbor, and make a right turn at that light. The hotel offers complitary in-room coffee (pot & fixin's), but we chose to walk accross the parking lot to the starbucks most of the time. Also nearby was sushi, subway, and an italian place, to name a few. I found the hotel on Tripadvisor, and learned it's in the top 10 of San Diego Hotels. it was close to the airport, and it was also fairly close to downtown, and Oldtown. We didn't learn until we got there that the San Diego Wild Animal Park was about 30 mi NE of town, but with the rental, we were able to take the Balboa highway (forget if it was Hwy, Blvd, Rd, Pkwy, etc.), and it was a beautiful drive. Speaking of Driving, if it's your first time doing so in CA, be careful. You may want to go the speed limit, but others may not. Most will go WAY over the limit, while a few will be under. I thought I was going fast at 5mi over, but I was in the slow lane. We took in the Wild Animal Park, the Zoo, and the Old town Trolly Tour, which was all we had time for during our long weekend. Pack lots of sunscreen, a camera (with lots of film, or a memory card big enough to hold all the pics you will take!), a sweater/jacket, and start your days at the attractions early, as most are all-day events.

Reviews.Title: “Just a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hulasurf
Reviews.Content: It's an ok hotel but the rooms were small. We had a suite the first night and the bathroom drains smelled so bad we had to keep the door shut and request a new room the next few nights. The next room was down the hall facing the front of the hotel so there was an overhang that fronts the lobby. The overhang was used for other guests empty beer cans and cigarett butts. That was room 232. So needless to say when my daughter pointed it out I was a little disappointed. It's as if know one from the hotel has ever looked out these windows to see the garbage. Minimal sound proofing between the rooms and the worst is the slamming of doors from the hallway. It might be fine for a business hotel but is lacking for the family and is very average in my book. The front desk staff seemed great and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Courtyard we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: Very new Courtyard in a convenient location to many San Diego locations. Rooms are very comfortable and include a nice flat screen TV. There is a nice walking path behind the hotel (if you do not mind the occasional airplane taking off). Food was decent and pricing fine. Very modern hotel. Excellent fitness center equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - attractive rooms.”
Reviews.Author: denverprincessaj
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was well-worth the price paid. My only complaints would be that I found a dirty washcloth on the towel rack when we entered the room and the breakfast buffet was pretty meager. Location, on the other hand, was very convenient, particularly in proximity to the airport. It is behind a few convenient restaurants offering a range in cuisine. The hotel room and common areas were very modern, asian-inspired and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “polyester towels says it all”
Reviews.Author: bklynguy
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is fairly new and pretty. The location is good, as all the hotels since the airport is within 3 miles of downtown. I just don't see what others are seeing with their rave reviews. Average at best. Awful polyester towels that you can literally almost see through, some with mascara stains. Bed shhets were torn, room small to average size. Staff very pleasant, but we just feel the price was too expensive for the services we got.

Reviews.Title: “Best Courtyard I Have Ever Stayed At!!”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard at the end of a four day stay in SD because I had to catch an early flight at the airport and wished I had stayed at the Courtyard the entire trip!. Like others have said, this is a new hotel that is wonderfully decorated and has all of the latest "must haves", like a flat screen TV (this one actually has High Definition channels... it amazes me that in other hotels they go to the expense of putting in flat screens, yet they don't have high def signals to take advantage of the technology), a Keurig coffee maker, recessed LED lighting, input cables for the TV, etc. The location is perfect... near everything... the staff was great... As I said, I regret not staying longer to take advantage of all it had to offer... next time I'm back in SD, I will definately stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DPSandDots
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 have spent 4 days here at the Courtyard. First, reading the most recent reviewer comments below shows the consistent and well earned positive ratings. The hotel is about 2 minutes from the airport but you would never know it. The flight patterns are far to the east, and the area is very quiet. There are some very nice advantages to this location. We wanted a central location to access San Diego attractions. We were 15 minutes from Coronado, 10 minutes from Gaslamp Quarter, 10 minutes from the Zoo and Sea World, 20 minutes from Wild Animal Park and La Joya. Parking is free, rooms are new and comfortable. We are a party of 5 and there are no rollaways. We used the narrow sofa bed mattress and some sheets for our 5 year old and it was fine. Extra blankets and pillows came quickly, as did anything else we wanted. Breakfast was a modest brunch with an omellete waffel station. There is a bar in the center of the lobby and a heated pool with hot tub. It was cool, upper 50's and we swam in both at night. The workout room was well equipped, laundry room, and free wifi in the room. and public internet access and printer in the lobby. There is a nice takeout cafe alternative for breakfast and lunch. Just outside the hotel is a strip mall with about 7 or 8 restaurants, sushi, Italian, Mexican, etc. TCBY and Starbucks too. To the East is a large park, where you can jog, play ball, and safe tot park. The area is known as Liberty Station, a modest residential one. We would definitely stay again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for SeaWorld and other Attractions”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: Booked here because of an excellent Ebreaks rate from Marriott.com. Brand new hotel with more amenities than your standard Courtyard. Restaurant, Bar, and Delicatessen/coffeebar on-site. Great location for morning joggers and walkers due to the waterside parkland area. Perfect spot for travelers who plan on visiting San Diego's attractions(SeaWorld, Zoo, Wild animal park, etc). If your looking for something more urban, I would stay elswhere. There really isn't any "nightlife" within walking distance. We paid $95 a night and it was perfect for relaxing after a day at the theme parks. If I am visiting for the city life I stay at the Marriott Marina.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: allisonandjeff
Reviews.Content: After a stressful and less than stellar stay at a convention/downtown hotel, I moved to the Courtyard Liberty Station the night before leaving for an early morning flight, given its proximity to the airport. What a pleasant surprise! I wish I had stayed here for my entire trip to San Diego. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful. The hotel is brand new and has ammenities I have not seen in more expensive and higher rated hotels. Standard rooms have very comfortable beds, attractive and modern decor, a huge HD flat screen TV, single serve coffee maker and fridge, a clock radio with ipod docking station. The desk had a power strip and all kinds of video input options with cables. You could turn the TV to face you while working at the desk on the free wireless internet. There is a restaurant in the hotel and a Starbucks/deli, but there are more dining options. It is a brief and safe walk to a new shopping center with a nail salon, massage place, a sports/pizza bar, Subway, TCBY, a wine bar and a good greek restaurant if you don't want to pay the high prices of the hotel restaurant. The hotel faces the bay and there is a lovely walking path - bring your running shoes. Given all there is to do, one can forget they really came here to sleep - and a good sleep it was; comfortable beds and quiet. I concluded my stay with a free shuttle to the airport. I was pleasantly surprised by my stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravisMizzou
Reviews.Content: Great location for San Diego. Free parking a plus! Free internet in the rooms with easy accessiblity. Close enough to downtown and just far enough. New Courtyard and you can tell when you walk in. Staff still being broken in with it being opened a few months ago. Great access to bike and jogging trails along the San Diego Bay. Breakfast is not cheap; however, other options easily within walking distance and they have a deli on site as well with healthy options in the morning. We will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: KKAustin
Reviews.Content: What a great place. This hotel is conveniently located less than 5 minutes from the airport. Yet, it doesn't seem like one of the same old airport hotels. They have gone above and beyond in making this place special. The rooms are very stylish and clean. The HD flat screens make watching TV very easy from any point in the room. The internet worked great and the bathroom was also clean and nice. The grounds are beatiful and there is a park nearby for walking and relaxing. Although I only ate breakfast at the hotel one day, I will second what another reviewer said and say that the sevice was less than stellar. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't as good as expected. Downtown is close by and there is a grocery store and other places close by as well. I'm going to be staying here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property - Rivals boutique hotels”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelnescape
Reviews.Content: LOVED the brand new facilities - lobby bar, outdoor patio with firepit and water views, and all the modern conveniences - business center, sundries shop, deli, on-site guest laundry. I also loved the layout of the guest room with a fresh take on how to make the most of a small space without appearing crowded (clever placement of fridge, closet, TV, and desk area). Conveniently located, near new restaurants and shops, and less than 10 minutes away to Sea Word, airport, and Downtown. The NOT SO GOOD - I could hear planes take off from the airport in Room 158. This wasn't as bad as constantly hearing a door open and shut loudly to a service area nearby. Poor service in the restaurant - We weret tired of standing around waiting to be seated, then helped ourselves to breakast buffet. Half-way through our meal a server finally acknowledged us and offered drinks. Had breakfast again the following day and same poor service (two different servers on staff). I discovered a billing discrepancy with my breakfast bills at check-out and received a comp for the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel, staff needs to get their act together”
Reviews.Author: familyof4inpa
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the new Courtyard Liberty Station (Aug 8-12 2008). The good stuff: This hotel is brand new, and the facilities are gorgeous. It smells like new carpet when you walk into the loby (we're not used to that). All rooms have a small (very small) refrigerator, huge flat panel TV, a pretty cool coffee maker, a good amount of space, and a large bathroom. The rooms on one side of the hotel are waterfront. The swimming pool is a decent size and it is heated so that you can even swim at night in San Diego without freezing in the cool air. The hot tub was very hot and big enough for six adults. There are plenty of tables outside and it was easy to find a spot by the pool. The not-so good stuff: Many of the rooms do not have a view. The first room that we were given, which we were told by the front desk was a water front room, had a tiny balcony (maybe 18 inches wide) and it overlooked a terra cotta roof on the second floor -- no water view. We called the front desk and were immediately moved to a better room, with a view, and a much larger balcony. The bigger balcony had no furniture - which I found strange. We were there for four nights and our room was only cleaned by the maid only twice. One of the two times the maid came was because we asked the front desk that day to make sure that our room was cleaned. When the maid cleaned the room, the small bottles of shampoo were not refilled. The coffee cannisters that can make one cup each in the room were not replaced after they was used. We actually ran out of toilet tissue on one of the days without maid service. The hotel ran out of towels by the pool on three occasions during our stay. At checkout, I told management about our issues and no appologies were made. I was told by the manager that she had been "off" for the last few days. When I told her about the coffee she told me that the hotel may be out of the in-room coffee, but that complementary coffee is available to all guests in the loby and that I should have known that from reading information left in the room. Anyway, we did like the hotel, regardless of our small problems. The location is pretty central. We were able to get to Old Town for dinner in about 10 minutes, Ocean Beach is about 15 minutes away, and La Jolla Cove was about 25 minutes away. Our kids really enjoyed the pool and the firepit is a nice touch at night. I rated this hotel above average, because I think that the hotel has great potential and it opened for business only very recently.

Reviews.Title: “Great brand new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel in a nice area near Point Loma. It is on an old military base that has been completely redone into a really nice retail/residential space. The hotel is in a very convenient location; plenty of surface parking. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The pool and hot tub were nice. There is a HUGE park and walk along the river immediately behind the hotel. Don't miss the opportunity to take a stroll around - it is wonderful! The room itself was tastefully decorated and everything was new and clean. The free internet was good; my only complaint was that the free internet was a little slow because of course they want you to upgrade to the paid internet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel--highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: landr
Reviews.Content: Fabulous NEW hotel--very modern amenities with beautiful furnishings. Great beds, Ihome alarm clock, plasma TV, beautiful bathroom. Nice pool and waterfront area. Nearby are shoppes, restaurants and Sea World. We stayed there because we had an early flight. The airport is a 5-minute ride via the complimentary shuttle. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Bedin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from San Diego after spending the weekend at this Courtyard. This was our first time staying close to Gaslamp and we were a bit hesitant at first... WE LOVED IT!!!! this property faces a little bay that even though small is enough to make your early morning stroll relaxing and fresh. The hotel grounds are extremely well kept (brand new property) and the hotel staff was very friendly. The room was impeccable and spacious (we got a two queen bed room facing downtown and the bay), our only complaint was that the "fancy" coffee maker didn't work at all and they never took care of it even though we mentioned it the first morning. This didn't really affect our trip since Starbucks is on walking distance (on the same plaza). The pool looked big enough, the jacuzzi was tempting but didn't get to use it, and the outside fire pit was a great touch. We didn't use the breakfast buffet since we normally like to go grab breakfast somewhere else, but we walked around and were surprised by the selection. We will definitely go back to this hotel on our next visit to our FAVORITE CITY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Courtyard Convenient to all the Sights”
Reviews.Author: OHChris
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights in July at the tail end of our western vacation. This hotel is a typical Courtyard, meaning you get exactly what you expect. It is still very new, in great condition and clean. The front desk staf bent over backwards to accomodate requests. We got a King room with a pullout couch for our 7 year old. Marriott beds and linens are excellent. The bathroom was fairly large, but there was a small leak in the elbow under the sink. They have the new K-cup coffee makers in the rooms which is great for coffee, but they did not provide tea. There was a fridge in the room which was very convenient. The room had the Connect feature which allows you to run your computer off the HD TV screen and to plug in your MP3 to play over the TV speakers. The room also had a small balcony. My daughter LOVED the pool which was outdoors, but heated. I loved the jacuzzi. The hotel cafe served breakfast and dinner for an additional fee, although we did not eat there. The hotel is within 10 minutes or less of Seaworld, the Zoo, Old Towne and the Gaslight areas. Parking is free and there is a free shuttle to and from the airport. Our only issue was we had a 5:00am shuttle scheduled and the driver was a good 15 minutes late (he must have slept in!). What made it worse, was they share the shuttle with the other hotel, I think it was a Hilton Garden Inn, and after we got on with 3 other people from the Courtyard we stopped at the HGI and there were 7 people that had the shuttle booked for the same time. There was no room for everyone and the people at the HGI had to wait for him to drop us off and return. Overall, a good predictable hotel although a bit pricey. I wish Courtyard would include a breakfast in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very New Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: sed953
Reviews.Content: This hotel just started taking reservations in May 2008, so it's only about 2 months old. It is in pristine condition and very clean. It's too soon yet to tell if it will be well maintained but as of right now it's very clean and pretty. It is situated in Liberty Station which is newly remodeled and very well designed and landscaped. The hotel has a view of part of the bay and you can see the airport, but not hear the planes, thankfully. The rooms are small but space efficient. The beds are springless and very comfortable. The TV's are flat screen and high definition. There is a nice workspace and a fold out couch. The bathroom is roomy with nice fixtures. The halls are under-airconditioned and fairly small. There is a lounge with well appointed chairs and tables with lots of plasmas and even a fireplace. The fireplace is two sided with the other side in a partially outdoors terrace. There is a nice pool with a decent sized jacuzzi. I really liked the firepits they had for sitting around outside at night. Overall the hotel is very well designed and pleasant to look at. Enjoy!!

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Airport/Liberty Station
HotelInfo.Address: 2592 Laning Road, San Diego, CA 92106
